With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isata. Isata is age thirty; she was born in  eastern Sierra Leone. She is currently residing in Kenema, together with her husband and child who is attending primary school. Isata has been a businesswoman for six years now. She sells drinks – both hard and soft. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy crates of both soft and hard drinks to add to her bar.

loans.use: to buy crates of both soft and hard drinks to add to her bar

loans.name: Deuyama Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Deuyama” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses. Musu is the leader of this group. Musu is thirty-nine-years old. She is married to a teacher and the couple have two children. Musu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). With the help of this loan,  she will buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: The Help Sisters Group

texts.en: Meet with members of the “Help Sisters” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 6,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mamie is the leader of this group. The thirty-eight -year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Mamie has been a businesswoman for eight years now. She sells clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy bales of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy the bales of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Muloma Group

texts.en:
Tity is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Tity was born in Kenema city, about thirty-seven years ago. She is married to a farmer and the couple has two children who are attending secondary and primary school. Tity sells market-food – palm-oil (the country most favorite cooking oil), etc. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now.
With the help of this loan, Tity and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Tity will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy T-shirts, sneakers, etc. wholesale to add to current stock

loans.name: Shaheera

texts.en:
Shaheera is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She lives in Irbid, Jordan.

Shaheera is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD so that she can buy and sell clothes to pay her son's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She lives in Idon, Irbid, Jordan. Eman is a conservative woman and she us unwilling to upload her photo on the Internet. The photo is of her husband.

Eman is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so that she can improve her house to make it more healthful.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She is blessed with two children age 16 who are twins. She describes herself as active, focused and sociable. She operates a tailoring shop where she sells dresses. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a favorable residential area and her primary customers are local residents. In addition, she farms to add to her source  of income.

Earlier on she had requested a loan of 20,000 KES from SMEP DTM, and she was able to repay it well. She describes her biggest business challenge as delayed payments from customers and inadequate funds for improving the business. She hopes to use the loan of 30,000 KES to improve her business by buying more fabric for making dresses to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of clothes materials. Esther plans to use the anticipated profit to  buy land.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making dresses she will sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two more cattle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 57-year-old man. He lives with his wife, Berta, and his three children: Jeni, 26, who works as sales clerk; Agustina, 24, who is working as a teacher; and Joica, 20. Actually, he has six children, but three of them are married and live with their own families.

Moses has a rice mill business that has been running for two years. The income generated from the business helps him meet his family needs, but lately the rice mill machine often doesn’t work well, so he has to spend much money to repair the machine. 

Moses desires to buy new engine fittings, but it is expensive and he doesn’t have enough money.

He needs additional capital of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase new engine fittings for his rice mill machine. When TLM’s staff offered a loan for him, he got interested in joining TLM and then applied for a loan of IDR 5,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase new engine fittings for his rice mill machine.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Majeda is looking to have a loan of 300 JOD so that she can fix and repair her home.

loans.use: to fix and repair her home.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 12 years, he has operated a business making fruits juices for sale and selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. Salim dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, he wants to purchase a new cooler box to store fruit juices for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new cooler box to store fruit juices for sale.

loans.name: Hendro

texts.en:
Hendro is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He is now studying at the university in the fourth semester. While attending college, Hendro is also running a business of selling cattle. He does it to assist his father in meeting his tuition fees.
 
Hendro usually purchases cattle at a local market and raises them for several months, then resells them to customers in another market. 

Hendro is expecting that the business will enable him to generate more income for his family and to support his college fees. 

Hendro intends to buy three more cattle to be raised, and he needs more money to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. The loan from TLM will support him in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy three more cattle to be raised.

loans.name: Mwadai

texts.en:
Mwadai  is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, he has operated a restaurant business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. His major dream is to establish a big restaurant to accommodate more customers in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, and rice.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and rice.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is married to a businessman, and they have two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. They live in a rental house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, Mapenzi has operated a grocery business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a grocery shop in the future to sell her goods in the market.

With the KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel con su anterior credikiva compró, una mesa de acero para la elaboración de productos derivados d e la harina de trigo, y también harina huevo, queso, y productos desechables, con los que aumentó su volumen de ventas. En la actualidad planea acceder a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina, para exhibir el queso, un freídos que facilite el proceso productivo, materiales al por mayor para continuar vendiendo por libras y ganar buenos descuentos y como actualmente vende productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, también invertirá en cosméticos y bisutería, que vino en descuentos lo que constituiría un nuevo ingreso adicional y esto es la razón de éxito de su nueva inversión credikiva. Su mensaje  los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Le doy gracias por haberme ayudado y le pido a Dios que los siga bendiciendo para que así puedan seguir ayudando a muchas personas. “
texts.en:
Isabel, with her first Kiva loan, bought a stainless steel table to make products derived from wheat flour and egg flours, cheeses, and other perishable food items which increased her volume of sales.  

She currently plans to accept a second Kiva loan, with which she will buy a glass shelving unit to display her cheeses, a fryer to speed the production process, products to sell by the pound in larger wholesale amounts to get better discounts, and since she already sells products via catalogs and specialized guides, she will also invest in cosmetics and accessories which she can buy at a discount and would provide a new source of income.  

This is the reason for her new micro-finance loan investment.  Her message to the Kiva investors is this: "I thank you for having helped me, and I ask God to continue to bless you so that you all can continue helping many people."

loans.use: to invest in cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Puji

texts.en:
Puji is a 35 year-old-lady who is married to Soleman. Puji and husband are blessed with 3 sons: Fernando, 11, is studying in the fifth grade of elementary school; Prayogi, 6, is attending a play group; Billi is only 3. 

Puji has operated a kiosk business for eight months. She sells mobile phone recharges, daily basic needs and snacks. Her husband, Soleman, works as a minivan driver. He drives his own car. 

Unfortunately the car is broken and her husband can’t produce income from the business. Puji has spent her business income and even business capital to help her husband to fix the car.

Puji wants to continue her kiosk business by purchasing products such as sugar, instant noodles, coffee, milk, eggs, bath soap, detergent, etc., to sell. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. She is expecting that the loan can support her in improving the business.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk products such as sugar, instant noodles, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es: Eric con su anterior credikiva compró insumos como maíz, papa, arroz: y algunos enseres como ollas, cucharas, para la elaboración de los productos que ofrece. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo  credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, nuevamente  insumos, porque los días de la madre, el padre y la secretaria, que se acercan trae consigo muchos encargos de comidas para estas celebraciones y esto es justamente  lo que hace que esta inversión tenga éxito. Su mensaje a los finaciadoresde Kiva es el siguiente: “Dando agradecimientos por la forma de apoyar al microempresario, para salir adelante con sus proyectos de empresa”
texts.en:
Eric used his previous Kiva loan to buy supplies such as corn, potatoes, rice and some equipment, such as pots and spoons, in order to make the products that he sells. Currently he is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy supplies again, but in greater volume. Mother’s Day, Father’s Day and Secretary’s Day are approaching and these celebrations bring with them many orders for food. This insures that the investment will be successful.

Eric’s message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you for helping small businessmen succeed with their business plans.”

loans.use: to purchase items such as corn, potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and the high cost of transportation. 
For the past three years, she has been weaving makuti(coconut-palm fronds for thatching), selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of owning a café in the future. 

With the KES 10000, she wants to purchase makuti to sell, and also some coconut-palm fronds to weave makuti to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access funds for her business.

loans.use: .to purchase makuti to sell, and also some coconut-palm fronds to weave makuti to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a single mother with one child; she runs a food café from home. Rukia has been running her business for eight months and has no other source of income. Her greatest expenses are school fees and personal upkeep. 

She requests the loan to expand her existing business by purchasing wheat flour, rice, and add some utensils. Rukia's main customers are her neighbors and her greatest challenges to the business are seasonality. She decided to work with Yehu to improve the current living standard of her family and her dream is to open a hotel.

loans.use: to expand her existing business by purchasing wheat flour, rice, and add some utensils.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married mother with one child who is currently attending school. Her husband is a businessman and they live in their own house yet without electricity or piped water. Their biggest monthly expenditure is school fees.

Emily has her own tailoring business that she has been running for over 20 years. She also sells henna and potatoes from home. Her customers are her neighbors. 

Emily wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying more clothing materials and threads for her tailoring business. She predicts that the greatest challenge facing her will be selling on credit. Emily’s dream is to open a tailoring school.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more clothing materials and threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Faryaal

texts.en: Faryaal is a woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She sells french fries from her home and dreams of opening a food stall in the future. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes school fees to be her greatest monthly expense, and seasonality to be her major challenge. Faryaal joined Yehu to get loans to expand her business. With the Ksh. 20,000 she will be able to purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes in a big quantity.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman without any children. She operates a general shop, selling household consumptions and has been in the business for the last two years. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Another source of livelihood is farming, and she describes seasonality and high transportation cost as her major challenges. Lucy dreams of hiring some employees in the future even as she aspires to expand the business. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and food.
With the loan of KES 50,000, she will be able to add stock to her general shop.

loans.use: to add stock to her general shop.

loans.name: Salvador Genovéz

texts.es: Salvador Genovéz vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace ya varios años, es por eso que tiene experiencia muy valiosa en la agricultura, quiere aumentar la producción en su cultivo pues cada vez tiene más demanda ya que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable trata a su clientela muy amable; Salvador es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, y con muchos sueños a futuro, piensa que para ser un triunfador, hay que creer que somos triunfadores, con este pensamiento positivo es que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz y frijol de la mejor calidad, abonos y controles de plaga, además de otros insumos para la agricultura. Salvador Genovéz tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida que la que ha tenido hasta antes del financiamiento esperado
texts.en:
Salvador Genovéz lives together with his life partner and his children; he has earned his living growing corns and beans for many years, and for this reason he has a lot of experience in agriculture.  He wants to build upon the amount of production in his fields because he has more and more demand now that all his production is of very good quality and he sells at very good prices, and also because of his unbeatable, fine treatment of his customers.

Salvador is a really hardworking and responsible man, and he has many dreams for the future.  He thinks that to be a winner, we have to believe we are already winners, and with this positive thought, he decided to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL that will permit him to buy the best quality of corn and beans for planting, fertilizers, pesticides, and other inputs for agriculture.  Salvador Genovéz is confident that it will help him to give his family a better quality of life than they have previously had from this hoped for financing.

loans.use: corn kernels and beans, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia Estela de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras ambulante en un vehículo, vende de todo tipo: naranjas, cebollas, repollo, brócoli, entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues toda  lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es único, ella siempre está a la orden de los clientes; Sonia es una mujer entregada a su labor siempre aprovechando las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que no hay que poner un límite para alcanzar un sueño pues nada es imposible, con este pensamiento se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cantidad de naranjas, cebollas, papaya, repollo, brócoli, y otras que han demandado sus clientes y no ha podido comprar con recursos propios. Sonia Estela tiene la certeza que de esta forma podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old and lives with her partner. She owns a vehicle, which uses to sell produce like: oranges, onions, cabbage, broccoli, among others. She has many customers because everything that she sells is of first quality and affordable prices, in addition the service is unique, she is always ready to serve her customers. 

Sonia is a woman dedicated to her work and always taking advantage of the opportunities that are available. She thinks that there must not be a limit to achieve a dream because nothing is impossible. With this thought, she decided to request to INTEGRAL a loan to buy oranges, onions, papaya, cabbage, broccoli and others  products that her customers have demanded her but has not been able to buy with her own resources.  Sonia Estela is sure that in this way she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oranges, onions, papaya, cabbage and broccoli

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds of the best possible quality, as well as fertilizer and pest controls.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto vive junto a su compañera de vida en zona rural al occidente del país, se dedica a la agricultura y ya tienen experiencia en el ámbito, sembrar maíz y frijol y sus cosechas son de las más abundantes en la zona, es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos; los granos que obtiene son muy solicitados por los clientes ya que todo es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además que el servicio es inigualable, Gilberto siempre  es de los vendedores más amables; en esta oportunidad no cuenta con los recursos propios para completar la compra de semilla para maiz, frijol y maicillo y es por ello que se decidión en buscar el apoyo de su socio INTEGRAL para poder llegar al éxito, confia que con este financiamiento podrá al completar toda su siembra obtener la mas grande de sus cosechas y por ende mejores ganancias con las cuales espera apoyar a sus hijos y compañera de vida para que vivan en mejores condiciones.-
texts.en:
Gilberto lives together with his life partner in a rural region, in the west of the country.  His business is farming and he has experience growing corn and beans.  His harvests are the most abundant in his area.  This is his main source of income.  The grain that he produces is very much in demand amongst his customers because it is all top quality and he sells it at affordable prices.  In addition, the service he offers is second to none.  Gilberto is always a pleasant seller.

On this occasion, Gilberto does not have enough resources of his own to complete a purchase of corn, bean and sorghum seeds.  For this reason, he decided to request the support of INTEGRAL, to help him achieve success.  He believes that this loan will enable him to complete his sowing and obtain an abundant harvest.  This will, in turn, give him better profits which he plans to use to support his children and life partner so that they can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn, sorghum and bean seeds, as well as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Nora Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nora, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos todos  mayores de edad pero aún viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella para  ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, hot dog y otras comidas rápidas, jugos y gaseosas, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que él tiene una carreta en la cual todas las tardes vende sus productos, esta carreta la tiene en el terminal terrestre de esta ciudad lugar por el cual pasan muchas personas que se trasladan a otras ciudades y que consumen en su negocio. Trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00  hasta las 21h00. Lleva más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pan, salchichas, carne, gaseosas y otros ingredientes para las comidas rápidas. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Nora. She is 50 years old, married, and has four grown children. Only one still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Nora will help her husband, so she intends to utilize this loan for his business. He sells hamburgers, hot dogs, and other fast foods, as well as juices and sodas. Nora says that her husband has a cart from which he sells all of his products. The cart sits at the city bus terminal where many people from other cities pass through and stop to eat at his business. He works every day from 2pm to 9pm. He has been in business for more than 15 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy bread, sausages, meat, sodas, and other ingredients for making fast food. Nora has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because of the help that the loans have provided. Her dream is for herself and her family to have good health.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, meat, sodas, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana Isabel, habita en casa propia junto con sus dos hijos y dos sobrinos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ana  posee una tiendita en la cual vende diversidad de artículos tales como: arroz, frijoles, golosinas,  azúcar, aceite, detergente, etc. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación a logrado mantenerlo activo por todo este tiempo. Ella se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora  y responsable ya que las metas que se propone siempre las alcanza con mucho éxito. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer y lograr mejorar sus ingresos con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. De acuerdo a lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeña tiendita en la compra de mercadería  como: golosinas, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergente, café, leche, etc. De tal forma que su tienda siempre tenga todo lo que los clientes buscan y así poder alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Confía en Dios que así será. Vale la pena mencionar que esta muy agradecida con ésta institucion ya que en el pasado le brindaron la mano cuando necesitaba.
texts.en: Ana Isabel lives in her own home with her two children and two nephews who are studying.  Ana has a small store in which she sells diverse products such as: rice, beans, sweets, oil, detergent, etc.  She has worked at this business for many years and thanks to God and her dedication, she has been able to maintain an active business for all this time.  Ana is characterized as being very hard working and above all very enterprising and responsible since she always reaches the goals she sets with a lot of success.  Her dream is to see her business flourish and to improve her income with the objective of improving her quality of life and that of her family.  In compliance with her previous loan, she has made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in her small store by purchasing merchandise such as: sweets, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, milk, etc.  This way her store will always have everything that her customers are looking for and she will therefore be able to achieve her dream of improving her quality of life and that of her family.  She trusts in God that this will happen.  It is worth it to mention that she is very grateful to this organization since in the past, they have offered her a helping hand when she needed it.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Yeimis

texts.es: Yeimis vive al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla con sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 13 años, con quienes sueña un futuro promisorio en el que proporcione potencialidades de éxito a sus dos pequeños, motores de su vida de trabajo,  vendiendo comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, hamburguesas, papas fritas, . Su negocio funciona los fines de semas y festivos en su propia residencia  y vende de contado a transeúntes del sector  y a vecinos, familiares y amigos, que conocen los productos que Yeimis prepara y la prefieren. Su meta es lograr un crecimiento sostenido y de esa manera mejorar los ingresos de la familia, su mayor desafío es lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente para hacer crecer su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos, como salsas, panes, embutidos y carnes,  en mayor volumen, para desarrollar aun más su oferta. En su negocio Yeimis maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 36% razón financiera desde la cual proyectamos su crecimiento microempresarial.
texts.en:
Yeimis lives in the south-west of the city of Barranquilla with her two children who are 6 and 13 years old.  She dreams of a promising future in which she is able to provide her two little ones with the potential for success.  Her children are the motivation behind her work selling fast food such as hotdogs, hamburgers and fries.  Her business is open on weekends and holidays.  It is located in her home and she sells for cash to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members and friends.  They are familiar with the products that Yeimis prepares and are loyal to her business.  Yeimis' goal is to achieve sustainable growth and, in this way, improve her family's income.  Her biggest challenge is to build up enough working capital to be able to grow her business.  

Yeimis is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use it to buy supplies such as sauces, breads, sausages and meat in larger volumes so that she can develop her offerings even further.  In her business, Yeimis has a profitability on sales of 36%.  It is based on this financial indicator that we project the growth of her microbusiness.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sauces, bread, sausages and meat

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is now 33 years old. He is married to Rose and together they have two children. Daniel used his first loan to start a retail shop which has been very profitable.

Daniel is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to start a restaurant business in Nakuru town. He will use his loan to pay rent for his restaurant building and also to buy some equipment to start with. In the future, he hopes to expand this business and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to open a restaurant and buy equipment

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and single. For the past three years, he has been running a retail shop to earn a living. He has gained a lot of knowledge about business management because he has completed management training through Faulu Kenya.

Joseph is requesting a 100,000 KES loan to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, and tissue paper. In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, and tissue paper

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es: Waldo con su anterior  credikiva remodeló la terraza de su vivienda donde funciona el estadero, t también reparó el enfriador pues requería mejorar su latonería y pintura; ahora en su negocio está más confortable él y su clientela y por ello se siente muy satisfecho. En la actualidad necesita invertir en cajas de cervezas al por mayor, para tener este producto en su negocio para la venta al detal y vender también a otros negocios cercanos, que muchas veces se quedan sin vender porque no tienen cervezas en existencia.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Estoy muy agradecido con todas las personas que de una u otra manera han contribuido a conseguir los recursos que ahora utilizo en mi negocio.“
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Waldo remodeled the terrace of his home, which functions as a stage. He also repaired his cooler that needed to be refurbished with body work and paint. Now his business is more comfortable for him and his customers, so he is very satisfied.

At the moment, he needs to invest in cases of beer in bulk so that he will have it available to sell in his business. He will also sell some to other businesses nearby because they often do not sell beer because they have none in stock. His message to the Kiva lenders is as follows: "I am extremely grateful to everyone who has, in one way or another, contributed to helping me secure the resources that I now use in my business."

loans.use: to buy cases of beer in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia de 56 años de edad es una mujer viuda, que tiene 4 hijos y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí tiene una pequeña miscelánea y vende mercancía variada al detalle, como útiles de papelería, prendas de plata, ropa, calzado etc.  Su experiencia emprendedora data desde hace 25 años, cuando inició vendiendo pasteles, frituras y en general comidas rápidas; con ello le fue muy bien y pensó entonces en viajar a un municipio fronterizo donde compraba artículos variados, como suéteres y ropa de cama, a buenos precios y vendía a clientes que se lo habían encargado.  Tiempo después salió embarazada y no pudo seguir viajando, así fue como aunque buscó el apoyo de un colaborador , no resultó el negocio y le trajo pérdidas, por eso decidió estudiar belleza y cuando terminó esta tarea, se empleó en un salón de belleza, donde adquirió mucha experiencia durante 13 años y le fue muy bien, pero su esposo enfermó y debió abandonar esta actividad, para dedicarse a su cuidado únicamente. Cuando este falleció quedó sola y decidió generar ingresos mediante la venta de mercancía, por eso empezó a viajar  a la ciudad de Medellín, para comprar  mercancías y como le fue bien, posteriormente adquirió sus vitrinas y las surtió. En la actualidad en su barrio es muy reconocida y su principal clientela son vecinas, familiares, amigas, referidos preferiblemente empleados de colegios y universidades, que le compran para pagarle a plazos convenidos. En su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hija, para no descuidar la venta diario de su miscelánea, la que requiere que esté pendiente  permanentemente, porque allí vende de contado. En su familia son muy unidos y sus hijos y nietos forman parte de ella, con ellos comparte los gastos del hogar. María Eugenia tiene ingresos adicionales generados por 2 taxis de servicio público y también presta el servicio de peluquería siempre que puede,  a clientes fijos que no cambian su servicio de belleza y confían en sus conocimientos y experiencia, para lograr el mejoramiento de su imagen. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará  mercancía ajustada a la temporada de celebración del día de las madres, la secretaria, época en la cual sus ventas se incrementan y ella ajusta su oferta a las necesidades de su clientela femenina, que compra cosméticos, ropa, calzado, productos para el hogar y papelería. Y esta es justamente la razón del éxito de su inversión producto del credikiva.
texts.en:
María Eugenia, 62, is a widowed woman who has four children and lives in the city of Barranquilla.  There she has a little general store and sells a variety of merchandise retail, such as stationery supplies, articles of silver, clothing, footwear, etc.

Her entrepreneurial experience dates to 25 years ago when she began selling fried pies, fried foods, and fast food in general.  It went very well for her in this and so she planned to travel to a border town where she bought various articles, such as sweaters and bedclothes, at good prices; she sold to customers who had asked her to buy for them.

Some time later she got pregnant and was unable to continue to travel.  She sought the help of a partner but the business did not work out and it brought her losses.  This is why she decided to study cosmetology, and when she finished her studies, she got a job in a beauty salon where she acquired a lot of experience for 13 years.  It went very well for her, but her husband got sick and she had to abandon this work to care for him exclusively.

When he died, she was alone and she decided to generate income by selling merchandise.  She began to travel to the city of Medellín to buy merchandise, and as it went well for her, later she acquired her display cases and she stocked them.

Currently she is very highly regarded in her neighborhood.  Her main customers are neighbors, family members, friends, and referrals, preferably school and university employees, who buy from her to pay in negotiable installments.

In her business she receives her daughter's help taking care of the daily sales in her shop, which require her to be on duty all the time because she does business in cash.  They are very close in her family and her children and grandchildren are part of it.  She shares all the household expenses with them.

María Eugenia has additional income generated from two public-service taxis.  She also does hairdressing when she can for steady customers who do not change their beauty service and who have confidence in her knowledge and experience to improve their image.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy merchandise for the celebration of Mother's Day, a time in which her sales increase and she adapts her offerings to the needs of her women customers, who buy cosmetics, clothing, footwear, home products, and stationery.  And this is precisely the reason for the success of her investment, the product of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, footwear, home products, and stationery.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is 37 years old and is widowed with six children, five of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Proscovia has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells dried fish. 

Proscovia is requesting a 200,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy fish to sell. Her loan will help her expand her business and generate greater profits. Proscovia will use the profit from her loan to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to be able to continue to expand her business. 

Proscovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Proscovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Polonuevo, donde se dedica a la confección de ropa, experiencia que data desde cuando trabajó en una gran empresa, que se dedicaba a esta actividad. Desde hace 5 años ejerce el arte de la costura, de  manera independiente trabajando con  las técnicas de lencería y elaborando hermosos  ajuares para bebés. Su negocio le ha resultado muy provechoso,  porque ha ganado paulatinamente una clientela fija y a esta misma aprovecha,  para venderle mercancías variadas, negocio que adicionó para generar nuevos ingresos con su gran potencial de compradores, que cada día le refieren a otros  nuevos.    Su meta mas adelante es organizar su taller y tener su propio almacén, pero su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente, para alcanzar sus propósitos. En la actualidad esta aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, telas e insumos, comprará vitrinas para ordenar su exhibición  y aumentar sus ventas, cumpliendo con pedidos de sus mas apreciados clientes, quienes preparan sus regalos para celebrar el día de las madres y muy seguramente lo hará obsequiando detalles, que Lisbeth ha escogido con la calidad y ternura que la caracterizan con la que tiene a sus clientes estimulados a comprarle
texts.en:
Lisbeth, age 46, lives in the Polonuevo municipality.  She makes clothes, and her experience dates back to when she worked for a large company making clothes.  She has been exercising the art of making clothes for five years.  She works independently using the techniques to make lingerie and making beautiful outfits for babies.

Her business has been very profitable because she has gradually won over a fixed clientele.  She takes advantage of this in order to sell varied merchandise.  She added this business in order to generate new income with her great potential to have buyers.  Each day they refer new buyers to her.  

Her goal for later is to organize her shop and to have her own store.  However, her greatest challenge is that she does not have enough working capital to achieve her objectives.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials, fabric, and supplies.  She will buy showcases to arrange her display and increase her sales.  She will fill the orders of her most  valued customers.  

Her customers are getting gifts ready to celebrate Mother’s Day.  They very surely will do so by giving gifts that Lisbeth has selected.  She does so with the quality and tenderness that she is known for, which motivates her customers to buy from her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, fabric, and supplies.  She will buy showcases to arrange her display and increase her sales

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old. She is single and is raising five children, only two of whom are her biological children. For the past eight years, Grace has been selling eggs. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client and this will be her first loan.

Grace is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of eggs to resell. In the future, she hopes to establish a permanent location where she can raise poultry instead of only purchasing eggs.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en:
Misheck is 36 years old. He is married to Monicah and they have four children. For the past six years, Misheck has been a farmer and he earns a good income. This will be his second loan with KADET LTD. Misheck repaid his previous loan well and on time.

Misheck is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for this planting season. In the future, he hopes to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is married and has four children, two of whom attend school. He has been farming for one year and sells his farm produce to his neighbors. 

Hamisi is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase planting seeds and cultivate his farm.  Hamisi faces a major challenge during dry season. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Hamisi aspires to have more sophisticated farm equipments in the future.

loans.use: to purchase planting seeds and cultivate his farm.

loans.name: Pedrina Iduvina

texts.es: Pedrina Iduvina de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella posee una panadería donde vende pan en variedad dulce y salado, quesadillas, tortas, pastelitos entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona pues vende el pan más rico y calientito además está elaborado con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; Pedrina es una mujer emprendedora, honesta y sobre todo humilde, dispuesta a superarse y lograr un triunfo  a futuro, piensa que la presión y los desafíos son su más grande oportunidad de crecer, es así como se ha decidido solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, dulce, levadura etc. Pedrina tiene la esperanza que dado que su sabroso pan está siendo mas demandado y al incrementar su oferta obtendrá mayores ganancias, así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedrina Iduvina is 57 years old and lives with her life partner.  She has a bakery where she sells sweet and salted bread, quesadillas, pies and cakes, among other things. She is well known in the region since she sells the freshest and mos delicious bread.  Furthermore, it is produced with high quality ingredients and she sells it at really affordable prices. 

Pedrina is an enterprising, honest and above all humble woman, ready to overcome and achieve a triumph in the future.  She thinks that pressure and challenges are her biggest opportunity to grow. So, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy flour, sugar, jam, yeast, etc.  Pedrina has the hope that, given that her delicious bread is more in demand and upon increasing her supply she will obtain higher profits, in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jam and yeast

loans.name: Ishmeal

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Ishmael from Waterloo, a neighborhood in Freetown. He is married with three children between the ages of nine and 15. He also has five relatives who live with him at home. For the past 11 years, Ishmael has been running a container store where he sells a variety of rubber and plastic containers. He works seven days a week from 8:00 am through 7:30 pm. His business is his only income source and his main business challenge is inflation.

Ishmael is requesting a loan to buy a variety of empty containers. He will use the profit from his loan to educate his children and increase his savings. In the future, Ishmael plans build more shops and expand his business. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of empty containers

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has one child.  She is a baker, which she has been doing for 45 years. She bakes bread to sell.  Ama uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home.  

Ama is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil  for her bakery. With the profits, she will buy the morden type of oven to make her baking easier.  Ama is standing in front of the oven she uses to bake.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil  for her bakery.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is 46 years old and a married woman, a mother of 7 children. She lives in Al Karak, Jordan.

Salwa is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can sell clothes to improve her social and economic level.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Nidian

texts.es: Nidian de 53años, vive en Soledad y es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 16, 24 y 30 años respectivamente. Ella tiene una miscelánea donde vende diversas mercancías y también se dedica parte de la mañana a preparar y vender almuerzos. Ambos negocios generan ingresos con los que ha generado cada día un mayor bienestar para sus hogares. Su vida como comerciante inició hace 6 años, vendiendo productos mediante guías especializadas, su negocio paulatinamente ha ido creciendo y por eso ha vinculado a él vitrinas, donde se ven bien exhibidos sus productos. Adicionalmente vende dulces, minutos a celulares, que se constituyen en otros ingresos, aprovechando a su clientela cautiva, que la visita día a día. Realiza las ventas de contado y a crédito, estudiando bien a su clientela. Los productos de dulcería y los insumos para preparar almuerzos, los adquiere en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla de contado, mientras las mercancías que ofrece en sus catálogos las adquiere a crédito. Su meta mas adelante, es hacer un local de mayor tamaño, donde funcione solamente su negocio, pero su gran desafio es lograr tener un fondo de efectivo suficiente para ampliar su negocio, responder a su clientela y tener siempre bien surtida su miscelánea. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financieminto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará productos cosméticos por catalogo, dulcería e insumos en mayor volumen para producir aun mas alimentos. Su éxito en esta inversión radica en su experiencia y que además su compra responde a los pedidos de su clientela y a la rotación actual de sus productos.
texts.en:
Nidian is 53 years old and lives in Soledad.  She is the mother of three children who are 16, 24 and 30 years old.  Nidian has a general store where she sells a variety of merchandise.  She also spends part of her mornings preparing and selling lunches.  These businesses both make her income which has helped her to improve the well-being of her household.

Nidian's life as a saleswoman began six years ago when she started selling products through specialized catalogs.  Her business has slowly grown and she has bought display cabinets where she can display her products nicely.  In addition, she also sells sweet treats and cell phone minutes which makes her additional income.  She makes the most of the fact that she has 'captive' customers who visit her each day.  Nidian makes her sales for cash and on credit, after carefully weighing up her customers.  She acquires her confectionery products and the supplies she needs to prepare her lunches in Barranquilla city center for cash.  She buys the merchandise that she sells through her catalogs on credit.  

Nidian's goal for the future is to have larger premises which are dedicated to her business.  However, her biggest challenge is having enough cash funds to expand her business, respond to her customers and ensure she always has a well-stocked store.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use it to buy catalog cosmetics, confectionery and a larger volume of supplies so that she can produce even more food.  Her success with this investment lies in her experience and the fact that her purchase is responding to orders from her customers and her current product turnover.

loans.use: to buy catalog cosmetics, confectionery and a greater volume of supplies for making food

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is twenty-five years old, a married man with one child, and he is a dairy farmer.  He has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of twenty-five  thousand shillings.


This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase animal feeds. In future he wants to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase  animal feeds.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is forty-one years old, a married lady with three children. She is a farmer, has been in the business for twelve years now, and gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 


This will be her third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs to improve her farming.


With the profits, she will rent another piece of the land. In future she wants to be a successful farmer

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Salamatu from Calabatown, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 24 and 27. One of her children attends school. Salamatu has four additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives from her village.

Salamatu runs a cookery where she prepares and sells local food such as fried rice, cassava leaves, soft drinks, and rice. She also runs a store where she sells cement. She has been running these businesses for 18 years and she works 11 hours every day except public holidays. Salamatu’s husband also provides income with his work as a driver. Her business challenges include transportation costs and time, as it takes her two hours to buy ingredients from town and return home. Salamatu starts preparing food at 4:30 am and she will not rest until it is finished.  

Salamatu is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more cement. The extra income from her loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her cement store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cement

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is a small-scale trader who has been selling saucepans, glass plates, and cups for three years now. Adwowa is a single parent and has three children, and she uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. 

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase saucepans, glass plates, and cups to sell. With the profits from the loan, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household items to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is a small-scale trader, and she has been selling plastic bowls for three years now. She is a single parent and has four children, and she uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase plastic bowls and baskets to sell. With the profit from the loan, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls and baskets to sell.

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 6 Group

texts.en:
Sandra is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Señor 6 (Help Us Lord 6). Her group is located in a rural area surrounding La Romana, called Bateyes, amid sugar cane fields. Sandra makes her home in a simple structure where she lives with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a very hardworking woman who is committed to her plans to change her family’s life and provide better living conditions including a better house and a good education for her children.

Sandra is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She runs a general store from her house and she will use her loan to increase her inventory by buying clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories. Sandra sells to her neighbors from home and she also walks into other communities. She plans to re-invest her profits into her business.

Sandra hopes to improve her house and business by saving and trying to have a stable source of income. She is very committed to making her dreams come true and she believes that, with God and this loan, she will have the opportunity to grow. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
For 20 years now, Aba has been producing palm oil for sale at Mpredwow near Cape Coast. She is a single parent with four children, and she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.   

Aba will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and kernels to produce her palm oil for sale. With the profit from the loan, Aba will buy a machine to produce her palm  oil.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her palm oil business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with five children. She has been operating a grocery shop at Batanyaa for 15 years. She sells items like tins of fish and tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. Lydia uses her income to support her husband and to pay their children’s school fees.    

She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profits from the loan, Lydia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is a hairdresser. She owns the beauty salon at Batanya near Cape Coast. Emilia is married with 3 children. Her husband is a welder. Emilia has been a hairdresser for 5 years. She uses her income to support the husband to pay their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to acquire equipment to make work easy.

loans.use: purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a petty trader. She sells groundnuts which she has done for 6 years now. Ama is single. She lives at Batanya, near Cape Coast. She uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of groundnuts to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of groundnut to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 39 years old, married and with two children. She runs a grocery business to earn a living. She has been in the business for 8 years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Hannah hopes to expand her business so as to employ people in her business. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy carrots, peas and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy carrots, peas and potatoes

loans.name: Rosebell

texts.en:
Rosebell is 41 years old and a single mother of two. She has been running a school for 3 years with six employees. She also does poultry farming to supplement her family's income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Rosebell has been able to run her business well. This is because she has been trained in business management skills.

Rosebell hopes to increase the number of pupils in her school. She also dreams of expanding her poultry farm. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old, married, and has five children.  He runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  He has been operating the business for two years and has employed one person. He has grown his clientele because of his good reputation.  
Charles desires to open a big hotel in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to pay wages to his new workers.

loans.use: To pay wages to his new workers

loans.name: Glenda Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Glenda, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada pero aun no tienen  hijos. Su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días por las mañanas ya que a esta hora es más fresco y se le hace más fácil salir y también vende en su casa a la hora que deseen sus clientes, ella deja a crédito  y cobra cada ocho o  quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 años, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño Jesús" (Divine Christ Child) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Glenda. She is 35 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband owns an auto repair shop.

Glenda intends to earn her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all types by going door-to-door, but she also sell from her home since customers come to visit her. Glenda works every day in the mornings since this is the coolest time of the day, thus making it easier for her to travel. She also sells from home whenever her customers feel that it is convenient for them. Glenda extends credit for her products and collects payments every eight or fifteen days. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil as often as needed. She has been in this business for five years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing. Glenda has been with the Communal Bank for six years and serves as president of the group. She enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to start her business. Her dream is to have a shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small business, selling motor spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more items, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and expand his business. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big company. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to stock more items in his shop

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mariama from Calabatown, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of two and five. Mariama also has one additional dependent living with her at home. For the past 12 years, she has been running a general store where she sells onions, tomatoes, milk, sugar, and Ovaltine. Mariama started her business to generate more income to send her child to school. She works seven days a week, 10 hours a day. This is her only source of income and her major business challenge is price inflation. 

Mariama is requesting a loan to buy more onions, tomato paste, milk, sugar, and Ovaltine. The extra income from her loan will allow her to pay her monthly installment and educate her children. In the future, Mariama plans to open another branch in town. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomato paste, sugar, and Ovaltine

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vendor. For two years, she has been cooking banku, which she serves with okro and fish stew, for sale. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and three children at Batanya near Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for the preparation of her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  To earn a living, she runs a laundry business.  She has been running the business since 2004 and has employed one person.  She has stabilized her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This has helped her to educate her children.
Faith hopes to grow her business and open other outlets in the future.  She needs a loan of 20 000 Kenya shillings to buy iron box.

loans.use: To buy an iron box

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old and married.  She sells potatoes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for over 10 years.  She has employed people to assist her in the business.  She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.
Catherine hopes to buy a hand cart for transporting potatoes to her business premise so as to save on transport costs.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Semeo

texts.en:
Semeo is 33 years old. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been running the business for 8 years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management skills. This has helped him to improve his business, hence more profits.

Semeo hopes to expand his business premise in the future. He needs a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking fat, soda and sugar.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, soda and sugar

loans.name: Eudora

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Eudora from Krootown central area in Freetown. She is divorced with 1 child, age 21 years. She has 3 additional dependents that live with her at home. She is also working as a teacher to increase her source of income. 

Eudora runs a provision and variety store within a business market area. She sells biscuits, pads, rubber drink, milk, sugar, energy bulbs and other items. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business 7 days per week. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition in the market and low capital to operate her business.

Eudora has requested a loan in order to buy more variety of stock such as biscuits, pads, rubber drink, milk, sugar, energy bulbs and other items. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her savings. In the future, she plans to open a bigger shop within the township. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more variety of stock such as biscuits, pads, rubber drink, milk, sugar, energy bulbs and other items

loans.name: Nafetha

texts.en:
Nafetha and her husband are photographed in the picture.

Nafetha is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and a mother with five sons and two daughters. One of her daughters has a beauty salon, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Nafetha is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as living room and bedroom furniture, instead of the very old furniture she has. Taking this loan will offer to Nafetha and her family comfortable home furniture and create to them suitable home conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is 30 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs and needs.

Fatema is requesting a loan for $2,000 from FATEN, which she will use to help her cover the costs of finishing her house, including installing tiles,  windows, and doors. This will improve the house's condition and enable the family to live in it soon. 

Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband AbdulRaheem appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the family's new house.

loans.use: to finish her house.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher, photographed inside his house, is a 27-year-old young man. He is married and the father of one son and one daughter. He is a taxi driver who earns low income. He also works in the field of electrical connections. This is profitable work but not enough to cover all of his family's needs.

Maher is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of finishing his house, such as painting and installing tiles. This will enable Maher to ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to finish building a new residence.

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en: Tiresa is 42 years old, married, and has one child. She has a plantation where she grows taro, banana, taamu, and ufi that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Tiresa needs a loan to to pay for cement, nails, a hammer, timber, and iron roofing to improve her home. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home

loans.name: Manu

texts.en: Manu is 36 years old, married, and has six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling German buns  in her community. To do so, she is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, coconuts, and plastic bags. In the future, Manu hopes to build her own food stall. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to start her business such flour, sugar, and coconuts.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili is 56 years old, married, and has seven children. She owns and operates a business venture, making elei (Samoan printed cloth), which she has been doing for one year. 

Saili is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy materials and paints. She hopes to use her profits to expand her elei business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to purchase materials and paints to expand her elei business

loans.name: Pepeu

texts.en: Pepeu is 70 years old, married, and has five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling handicrafts in her community. To do this, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy crafts to sell and materials such as timber for carving. In the future, Pepeu hopes to exports some of her handicrafts overseas. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to start a small business selling handcrafts in her community.

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es: Alexandra está satisfecha por el resultado de su anterior credikiva, pues logró comprar en un mayor volumen y reparara algunas herramientas de trabajo con las que a logrado mayor efectividad y tranquilidad. Ahora se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos e iniciará un negocio de restaurante mas organizado, asociada con una compañera, el cual ya está funcionando. En su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva, agradece la ayuda y que sigan apoyando a las microempresas. Auguramos éxitos en su inversión.
texts.en:
Alexandra is satisfied with the investment of her previous loan because she was able to buy supplies in large lots and to repair some of her business equipment. This has made her more productive and given her peace of mind.

She is now ready for a new Kiva loan to buy supplies and to start a better equipped restaurant in which she and a friend would be partners. Her message to Kiva lenders is that she is grateful for their support and that they should continue funding micro businesses. She predicts their investment will lead to success.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to equip her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Gloria has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells books and does printing. 

To help expand her business, Gloria has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more printing paper and books for resale, and will help Gloria to generate greater profits and to save money. Gloria hopes that in the future she will be able to set up another stall. 

Gloria is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gloria who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more printing paper and books for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Rebecca from Calabatown, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 11 and 32. Two of her children currently attend school and one is in university. For the past 16 years, Rebecca has run a bar and restaurant within a busy market where she sells soft drinks, Star Beer, Heineken, chicken snacks, fried fish, and fried rice. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband to support her family. Rebecca’s other source of income comes from renting out an old house. Her major business challenges are poor electric power supply and transportation costs.

Rebecca is requesting a loan to buy a variety of drinks and a generator. The extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her savings and educate her children. In the future, Rebecca plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks and a generator

loans.name: Izzeddeen

texts.en:
Izzeddeen is a 28-year-old single young man. He has been driving a taxi for 5 years, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover his needs and costs.

Izzeddeen is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing the taxi and making some necessary improvements to it such as changing the lights, installing new wheels and mirrors. This will increase the taxi efficiency and capacity and make it legal to move from one area to another. This will help to improve Izzeddeen's income positively.

Izzeddeen is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and improving the taxi's condition

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single young man. He has monthly income coming from a rental apartment he has. Also, he is preparing to open a grocery store, which will help him in the future to create better income to him.

Ahmad is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing different collection of groceries to open his grocery store and start selling to the customers. This will offer to customers a better collection to choose and buy from and to compete with others well, which will lead to increased sales and improve Ahmad's income.

Ahmad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase different collection of groceries for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to finish building her house.

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is a 19-year-old woman who is married with one child. She plans to start a small business making pancakes. Fuatino needs a loan to pay for goods to start her business. She will use her profits to improve her family's income. Fuatino joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Barry

texts.en: Barry is 18 years old and single with no children. He wants to start a small business making and selling printed fabrics, called lavalava, in his community. To do this, he needs a loan to buy materials. In the future, Barry hopes to expand his business. He joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a clothing business.

loans.name: Telesia Faleono

texts.en: Telesia is 35 years old, married, and has six children. She has a plantation where she grows taro, banana, and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Telesia needs a loan to to pay for weed killer, knives, and a wheel barrow. She will also use part of her loan to improve her house. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Telesia will use the profits from her plantation to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Tautega

texts.en: Tautega is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Tautega needs a loan to pay for oil, banana, taro, and a deep fryer. She plans to use her profits to help pay for her children's education. Tautega has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for making banana chips

loans.name: Tuilagi

texts.en:
Tuilagi is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a general store selling a variety of products in her community, which she has been doing for three years. 

Tuilagi is requesting a loan to expand her store. She plans to use her profits to continue improving the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to build up her inventory

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa is 43 years old, married, and has six children. She plans to start a small business, making elei (Samoan printed cloth) and sewing.  

Orepa is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a new sewing machine and some paints and materials for the elei. She will use her profits to expand her business. Orepa joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase materials to start a sewing business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Due to the hardship of living, Marites engages in a hog-raising business to earn additional income for her family. She is now 42 years old and has three school-age children. With her husband, she works to educate their children and give them a better life. 

Marites planned to raise more pigs to sell and increase the crop yields to cover her family needs. But due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000  to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that this loan will help her to improve her hog-raising business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 39, married and has four school-age children. They live happily in a village planting rice and raising livestocks for sale.  Eloisa aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income to satisfy their necessities and finance the schooling of their children. 

To improve her business, Eloisa is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that her loan will help her to make an improvement in her business and hopes that she will make her business grow and be more profitable someday.

loans.use: buy feeds, vitamins and piglets

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Eda

texts.en: Eda is a 51-year-old woman, and she is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer and also drives the van. Eda wants to help her husband repair and paint the van, but she doesn't have enough money so she needs to take out a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). When Eda gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband repair and paint the van. This will improve the van condition and enable her husband to work extra hours to increase the family's income, which in turn will improve the family's living conditions. Eda is a very loving mother and wife; she does everything for her family.

loans.use: to buy paint, tires, and pay for the maintenance of her van

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Due to the hardships of living, James engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a village, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. He is now 52 years old and has two adult children. He is aiming to improve his hog-raising business to earn and save more income for the future of his family.
