Because he has insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional PHP 34,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will improve his piggery and hopes that someday he will make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Brylen

texts.en:
Brylen is 23 years old and has one infant.  Due to lack of job opportunities, She engages in a business, raising hogs to help her husband generate income.  She has been operating this business for almost three years, earning a profit of PHP10,000  a month that she usually spends both on her family’s daily needs and saving for the future to provide for her child.

Brylen aims to strengthen her business and make it a viable source of income.  She planned to raise more pigs to sell, but she does not have enough capital.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.   She believes that through this loan, she will be able to make an improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
In addition to the household chores, Winnie engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband’s income.  She is now 36 years and has two school-aged children.  Due to financial difficulty, she aims to strengthen her business to help her husband finance their children’s education. 

She plans to raise more pigs to sell but, due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.  She believes that this loan will help her execute her plan to strengthen her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla and her husband are blessed with four children. The two oldest, Romulo, age thirty-two, and Michelle, age twenty-eight, both serve as church ministers. The third, Ronalyn, is twenty-six years old and an education graduate who now teaches. The youngest, Jirha, is sixteen years old and is studying at a high school.

Precilla raises hogs and also farms both rice and corn. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase feeds and additional piglet to support her business. Her goal is to expand her hog raising business to maintain her income and support the educational needs of her youngest child. Precilla said she must be strong and work hard in order to achieve her dreams, just like well-known entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To maintain her hog raising and farming businesses.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a 27-year-old married woman with two grownup children. 

She is very hardworking person, engaged in the business of selling different products to the people of her community. 

Hazel is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy additional products like canned goods, flour, rice and beverages so that she can generate additional income to meet her family's needs. In the future, Hazel hopes to expand her business to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris con su anterior  credikiva, compró insumos y algunas herramientas de trabajó con las que se acomodó rápidamente y ha hecho mas efectivo su trabajo, porque hasta le alcanzó para adecuar su cocina. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, que invertirá en el arreglo de lavadoras, y en la compra de insumos para el desarrollo de sus dos  negocios, la venta de alimentos y el servicio de alquiler de maquinas para lavar ropa. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco inmensamente la ayuda prestada a través del apoyo para sacar adelante sus negocios. “
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Damaris bought supplies and various business equipment that she quickly put to use. This made her business more productive because she was able to adapt her kitchen. Now she is applying for a new loan that she will use to repair washing machines and to buy supplies for her two businesses: food sales and washing machine rentals. 

Her message to Kiva lenders is: “I am immensely grateful for the loan, which helps me keep my businesses going."

loans.use: to repair washing machines and to buy supplies for her two businesses: food sales and washing machine rentals.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon has a heart for entrepreneurship and the educational background in management to make any business venture that he embarks on a sure success. In 2007, Marlon decided to combine these two aspects of his life and open his own business in Virginia. The business that he created was an all encompassing furniture rental, rent-to-own, and direct sale retail store. 

Currently, he has four employees, two of whom are members of his family. He says that this is one of the most important aspects of his business. He loves the opportunity the business gives him to employ individuals in his community, especially members of his family. The store has been very successful since its opening and recently Marlon moved locations to a bigger space. However, with this move, there has been a slowing of business because many people do not know the new location. Marlon would like this loan to advertise the new location and to increase his inventory to fill his new space.

loans.use: to market his new location and increase his inventory

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 30-year-old married man and has 2 children who live with him in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a mill ("tahoun") and has been involved in this business for 10 years. He purchases grain then sells the flour to his customers after milling. He was provided for by his father so that he was able to open his business. 

Mohammed is an incredibly hard-working man and as a result has a lot of experience. In addition, this is the main source of his income. On the other hand, through lots of effort, he has managed to grind his customer`s grain, i.e., he provides them with a service to put food on their tables. 

Recently, Mohammed took out a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grain for his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase grain for his business

loans.name: Delphin

texts.en: Delphin is 25 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a small business selling baked foods in her community and has been doing this for two years. Delphin has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Delphin will expend her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making baked goods

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, and bananas to earn a living. 

Salome has requested a loan to buy chemicals, taro, and other supplies for farming. She has been a member of SPBD for three years. Salome will use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow crops for sale.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a 22-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living, and she has two years of experience in this business. 

Angie needs a loan to buy supplies like plastic cups and sugar. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Angie has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma con su credikiva, pudo responde a los pedidos de su clientela porque compró mercancía variada como ropa, calzado, cosméticos y con ello ganó un poco mas de dinero. En la actualidad quiere comprar mayor volumen de mercancías variadas especialmente para la mujer, porque necesita tener un fondo de efectivo para comprar los pedidos que le hicieron para el día de las madres y de la secretaria que son fechas en as cuales tradicionalmente su volumen de ventas aumenta. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero recibido, esto me ha permitido aumentar mis ventas, mi capital de trabajo y mis utilidades, con las que aumento también mi nivel de vida”.
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Vilma fulfilled her customers' orders because she was able to buy a variety of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. As a result, she was able to earn a little more income. She now wants to buy a larger volume of merchandise, especially women's products. Vilma needs funding so that she can place her orders in time for Mother's Day and Secretary's Day, the dates when her sales volume normally increases.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is as follows: "I express many thanks for the financial support I have received. It has helped to increase my sales, my operating capital, and my profits, which have also raised my standard of living."

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of merchandise, especially women's products.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora and her husband are engaged in buying and selling personal use items and this has been the source of income for their family. She is 42 years old and married to Ruben. They live in Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, a rural and mountainous place. Their two children are still studying.

They buy personal use items like soap powder, lotion and liquid soap and sell them in the community. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP that they can use as additional capital for their business. Nora wants her children to have a better life and she is hoping that she can send them to college after high school. She believes that she can make it by working hard.

She hopes that her loan will be granted so she can have a continuous source of livelihood, which is a big help in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy lotion, perfume and soap for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice there is a gift." This is what Rebecca believes. Every day she is very optimistic that she can receive a gift through her business.

Rebecca is 61 years old and married to Euligio. They live in San Juan, Quirino province of Isabela and they are blessed with three children: Albert, Jenny and Janward. The family works hard for the fulfillment of their dreams in life.

Rebecca is a vendor in their village. She sells different merchandise in order to earn a living. Some of her products include vegetables, fish sauce, goto (congee), and halo-halo during summer in her little stall located near their house.

She would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used as additional working capital for her business. She is always busy with her venture to earn a living. She wishes that somehow, someday, they can uplift their poor living condition so that her children and future families will not suffer so much from life's difficulties.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, beverages and spices for her store

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 52-year-old woman married to Angelito. She is very diligent and hardworking person. She lives in the mountainous province of Isabela.

To have a better living she is asking a loan of PHP 18,000 to have business capital so that she can meet all the needs of her family. 

She wishes that someday, her business will expand so that she can reconstruct their house to have better living conditions and she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, snack foods, canned good and beverages for her store

loans.name: Hussin

texts.en: Hussin is a 48-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. His educational background is primary school. He is doing the best he can to support himself and live as he should. He built a house to settle down in with his family. He strives to apply himself to his family's needs. Today, he is asking to take out a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy building materials like cement for building an extra room.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement for building an extra room

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 19 years old and a single guy, has two sisters.

Mohammad has registered in college and chose to study business administration, a field that has to be involved in every aspect in our life and in any project, so it will allow him to find more opportunities and jobs in the future.

He has applied for this loan in order to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a conservative person, and for that reason, she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Yusra, 42 years old and a housewife, has four sons and daughters. Her husband has been working in the retail business for the last five years, and recently he decided to start his own business, so he bought a few home products and stacked them in his house. 

Now Yusra has applied for this loan to start with her husband to re-decorate a room in their house for organizing the products they have so they can start selling.  In the future she hopes they can build their own store next to the house to expand and get more revenue that can help in improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to re-decorate a room in their house for organizing the products they have

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda, 39 years old and a married woman, has four daughters.

Raeda has been working at home for the last six years tailoring, knitting scarves and gloves in the winter, and doing embroidery. During these six years she was able to start selling what she makes in big stores beside selling to her friends and neighbors. 

Now that there is demand for her products, Raeda is looking for a place to turn into a workshop and hoping to employ more tailors to help her. While looking for a place, Raeda will be buying sewing machines, knitting needless, yarn and thread and for that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines, knitting needles, yarn and thread

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 56-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells iced cakes and donuts in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Lina needs a loan to buy plastic cups, sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Lina has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making iced cakes and donuts

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 27 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling barbecue in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy ingredients like chicken, soya, and mutton. In the future, Maria hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a 27 year old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Mareta needs a loan to buy flour, yeast, sugar, salt, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. Mareta has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making pork buns.

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en:
Kilisitina is 25 years old and married. She has 2 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling bbq'd food in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy pack of chicken, mutton flaps, cucumber, plastic plates, etc. 

In the future, Kilisitina hopes to expand the business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bbq'd food items to sell.

loans.name: Good Rice Group

texts.fr:
Ananie fait partie du groupe Good Rice. Il a 56 ans, il est marie avec 9 enfants de 10 ans à 26 ans, dont  tous  9  scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.
Ananie est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Ananie voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ananie belongs to the Good Rice group. He is 56 years old and married with nine children ranging from 10 to 26 years old; all nine of the children have been to or are at school. He has one other dependent (apart from his children). He himself has six years of secondary education.

Ananie is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB and he is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor.

His strategy for growing his business is to ask for further loans to expand his faming activities. In the next few years Ananie would like to become a more significant rice producer in his region. With the profits he makes, he is planning to pay his children's schooling and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Liz Angélica

texts.es: Liz de 25 años de edad, vive al sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla, se dedica a la venta de calzado para damas, actividad que ejerce desde hace dos años, cuando dejó de trabajar como agente de ventas de un almacén  y al recibir su liquidación, emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, invirtiendo quinientos mil pesos COP en la compra de calzado para damas, aprovechando sus amigas necesitaban ir a una fiesta popular y requerían calzado para esa ocasión; así empezó su negocio y hoy cuenta con una clientela fija, referenciada por su trabajo y la buena calidad de los productos que vende. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, para lograr ingresos suficientes, con los cuales adquirir su propia casa y generar posibilidades de estudios para sus dos hijos, en las edades de 2 años y menos de uno, motores de su trabajo persistente en el negocio y el de su esposo.  En la actualidad su mayor desafío es no tener el  capital de trabajo suficiente para responder a la demanda del mercado, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará calzado para damas, sobre pedidos que han hecho sus mejores clientes para usar el día de las madres y para obsequiar a el ser mas maravilloso de la humanidad. Su inversión planea ser exitosa porque responde a la demanda del mercado, lo cual asegura su venta y ella responderá a sus más rentables clientes. Mientras esto ocurre, maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 32% desde el cual proyectamos y auguramos su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Liz is 25 years old.  She lives in the southwestern part of the city of Barranquilla.  She has been selling women's shoes for 2 years since she stopped working as a salesperson in a department store.  She received her severance pay and started her own business adventure, investing five hundred thousand pesos COP in the purchase of women's shoes.  She took advantage of the fact that she had friends who were going to a popular festival and needed shoes for that occasion, and that's how she started her business.  Today she has an established customer base, referred to her through her work and the high quality of the products she sells. 

Liz's dream is to expand her business so that she has sufficient income, which she will use to purchase her own home and make it possible for her 2 children to get an education.  Her children are ages 2 and less than one year.  They are the drivers behind her persistent work and that of her husband.  Her greatest challenge right now is that she doesn't have sufficient capital to respond to market demand.  For this reason she has come to credikiva. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to purchase women's shoes to fill orders that her best clients have placed to wear on Mother's Day and to give as gifts to the most marvelous person on Earth.  She believes her investment will be successful because it responds to market demand, which ensures that she will sell her product and serve her most profitable customers.  When this happens she will have a profit margin of no less than 32%, so we predict her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes to fill orders.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: A very young business man, Walid, 27 years old, has engaged in hog raising for five years. He has enough knowledge about fattening hogs, and he is continuing to develop his capability in raising hogs because he plans to have a piggery someday. That's why he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them to eat. Walid hopes that someday he can expand his business and explore and broaden his knowledge of hog raising.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for his business

loans.name: Kamlah

texts.en:
Kamlah, 42 years old and a married woman, has given birth to 10 sons and daughters. 

Kamlah has a small food products store that sells canned beans, tea bags, snacks, etc. Working in the store has helped her family in finding income sustainability. 

Now Kamlah has applied for this loan so she can bring in more food products and add some home cleaning products too to have a variety in her products.

loans.use: bring in more food products and add some home cleaning products

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah, 21 years old and a single lady, lives with her three sisters.

Samah has registered in the university to studying Special Needs education techniques as she wants to help people who have Special Needs to live a normal happy life. 

She has applied for this loan to pay for what is left from this semester’s fees and pay for the upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi, 22 years old and a single guy, has a brother and a sister. 

Majdi is a university student who is majoring in accounting. Majdi is looking to get a Master's degree in the future, but first he wants to get his Bachelor's degree and find a suitable job that can finance his Master's study fees.

Now he has applied for this loan in order to pay for his current semester fees to be able to register for the semester exams.

loans.use: to pay his current semester fees

loans.name: Filifilia

texts.en:
Filifilia is a 49 year old married woman. She has 6 children. She makes and sells barbecued food in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Filifilia needs a loan to buy pack of chicken, mutton flaps, cucumber, plastic plates, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. Filifilia has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make barbecued food items to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 27 year old married woman who has 2 children. She makes and sells chips in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Regina needs a loan to buy ingredients such as dripping, salt, taro and bananas, needed for making her chips. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Regina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chips to sell.

loans.name: One

texts.en: One is 31 years old and married. She has 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as daily-use products. She has been doing this business for 2 years. One needs a loan to buy new stock for the shop. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock, especially daily products, to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a young entrepreneur who started her business 24 years ago. She was eager to generate her own income to contribute financially in order to stabilize her family. When she learned about selling personal use products, she started offering these items to friends, neighbors, and people who live in the area.

Now, with the opportunity to gain higher income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy personal use products such as face powder and lotion. The good quality of her products enables her to attract a large number of customers and achieve a high level of sales. 

She just hopes that with the loan, she can save enough funds for the preparation of the studies of her child.

loans.use: to buy personal use products such as face powder and lotion.

loans.name: Loisi

texts.en:
Loisi is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a plantation where she grows taro crops and bananas that she can sell in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Loisi needs a loan to to buy farm supplies, such as  chemicals, bananas, taro crops and knives. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to grow crops to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 49, operates a small restaurant in the market selling foods such as viand and rice. Since she loves cooking, she built this kind of business. It has been the great source of funds for sending her children to school. She is grateful because, for over 25 years of operating this business, she has loyal customer already that provide her with an income. Through her friendly and kind character, she has gained customers and friends. 

With the unending requests of customers, Milagros is requesting additional working capital to provide for the necessary wishes of her customers. A loan of PHP 15,000 will be used to purchase pork, beef and rice to cook. She hopes that, through the loan, her business will be doing well and will make enough money to provide the necessities needed for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pork, beef and rice to cook.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 34-year-old married woman with 5 children, aged between 2 and 14 years. She has been engaged in farming for 6 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Each month, Rosalinda earns 3000 PHP doing this farming. She works hard to help provide for her family’s basic needs.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with 5 school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer.

Anita runs a sari-sari store business in her town in San Miguel, Bohol. She sells various items like softdrinks, canned goods and eggs. She also sells rice and feed. Anita is able to help buy her family’s basic needs with her income. She works hard to improve her income and to be able to sustain her children’s education.

Anita has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, feeds and canned goods. This will help increase Anita’s sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, feed and canned goods.

loans.name: Loraine

texts.es: Loraine  de 20 años de edad vive con su cónyuge en el municipio de Sabanagrande, muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla y allí se dedica al comercio. Actividad que desarrolla desde hace 2 años, desde que estaba estudiando su bachillerato  y tenia mucha atracción por las ventas, pues con ello le ayudaba a su madre. Así fue que cuando organizó su hogar también decidió aportarle ingresos para aumentar cada día su bienestar, y así lo ha hecho. Con su cónyuge han ampliado la línea de productos y hoy vende cosméticos artículos para el hogar, entre otros con los cuales da respuesta a los pedidos que día tras día hace su clientela. En la actualidad su meta mas importante es ampliar su negocio pero su desafío es no contar con el capital de trabajo suficiente para cumplir con este sueño. , porque tiene muchos pedidos y debe sortear cada situación, para poder cumplir. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  comprará cosméticos perfumería, plásticos, pues se acercan fechas especiales como el día de la madre donde Loraine espera hacer la mejor venta del año, tal  como está acostumbrada a lograrlo y teniendo su credikiva aumentará su capital para ser oportuna con su clientela, justificando así su razón de éxito  en la inversión.
texts.en:
Loraine is 20 years old and lives with her husband in the municipality of Sabanagrande, very close to the city of Barranquilla.  She has been a salesperson for 2 years, since finishing high school.  She was very attracted to sales, because she was able to help out her mother.  When she set up her home she decided she wanted to bring in income to improve her wellbeing every day, which she has done.  With her husband she has expanded the line of products she sells and she now sells cosmetics and housewares, among other items, which fill the orders she receives every day from her customers.   

Currently her most important goal is to expand her business but the challenge she faces is a lack of capital to fulfill this dream.  She has many orders and has to handle each one skillfully in order to fill them.  For this reason she has come to Kiva.  This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase cosmetics, perfume, and plasticware.  Special dates such as Mother's Day are approaching, and Loraine hopes to have her best sales of the year.  She is used to being successful and with her Kiva loan she will increase her capital to serve her customers and successfully use her investment.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfume, and plasticware.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María con su credikiva logró comprar más materias primas que lo acostumbrado, insumos y algunos utensilios para el desarrollo de su actividad. Hoy se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva y lo invertirá en la compra nuevamente de materias primas al por mayor y un poco mas de utensilios porque su negocio está en crecimiento. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias a todos por los aportes para poder incrementar mi negocio he visto como ha crecido y considero que crecerá aun mas si cuento con un apoyo como el de ustedes. “
texts.en: María used her previous Kiva loan to buy more raw materials than usual.  She also bought supplies and some utensils with which to develop her business.  She is now preparing to receive a new Kiva loan which she will invest, once again, in buying raw materials wholesale and a few more utensils because her business is growing.  Her message to Kiva lenders is as follows: "Thank you everybody for your contributions which help me to increase my business.  I have seen how it has grown and I believe that it will grow further still if I can rely on support like yours".

loans.use: to buy raw materials and utensils for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: A 44-year-old woman, Elena is a married woman with three adult children. She is very smart in terms of business. She has multiple businesses, but she wants to focus on her store, where she sells different products such as coffee, soap and perfume made by herself. She want to explore her knowledge. That's why she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy products such as coffee, soap and perfume that she can offer to customers and so that she can broaden her knowledge in her business in order to meet the needs of her family. She always prays to our all-mighty God that her business expands for the benefit of her family, and to her parents, who love her most.

loans.use: to buy coffee, soap and perfume for her business

loans.name: Alan

texts.en: A single man, Alan is 38 years old and single living with his parents. His focus is  establishing a business. He loves business he tried everything in his life so that he can give the need of her parents. He plan to married her live-in partner, Arlene this coming June, in able to start new business he requesting of loan amounting PHP 50,000 to buy materials such as paper, books and tarpaulin in his business for his future family. According to his family Alan is very responsible son and loving. That's why he is blessed everyday. He hopes that his business doing well so that he can give all the need of his future family.

loans.use: To buy materials such as paper, books and tarpaulin in his business

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en: Jovielyn, 41, resides in the village of Capellan, province of Isabela. She and her husband, Carlos, a furniture maker, have four children, three in school. The youngest is 4. She has run a variety store for almost 13 years. Managing her store provides income to help her husband meet the growing needs of their family. She wants a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP17,000 as additional capital. She wants her store to grow and become more profitable for her family. Jovielyn is hoping to continue sending all her children to higher levels of education for them to obtain better jobs one day. Through their own perseverance and diligence in working, she believes that they will be able to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy spices, snack foods, noodles and drinks for her store

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is from the village of Capellan. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. 


Leticia has owned and operated a general store for three years. Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in the community. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, noodles, coffee and spices for her store

loans.name: Magielyn

texts.en: Magielyn is a vegetable vendor, selling her own harvested vegetables in her village. She wants to increase her merchandise and would like to borrow 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). With the loan she can start to buy more vegetables that she can sell not only in her village but also in the market for a bigger income. She is hoping that lenders will grant her request for her business to become sustainable. Magielyn lives peacefully in her village of Capellan, in the province of Isabela, together with her husband who patiently works as a farmer. They have five children, two of whom are still studying.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 56 years old and endowed with strong determination and love for her family. She is married to Roberto. They have been married for thirty years and have two adult children. The family lives in a town in the province of Isabela.

Marilou sells grocery items at home, and she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items for resale such as canned goods, spices, noodles and beverages.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, noodles and drinks for her store

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya, 20 years old and a single lady, is the oldest among five sisters. They also have an older brother. Their father works as a truck driver, but Haya feels that it is hard for her father to support the whole family. For that reason, she has applied on her own for an educational loan to pay her semester fees. She is majoring in computer sciences.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 20 years old and a single guy, is one of five brothers in the family. They have only one older sister.

Mohammad is a university student majoring in civil engineering. He is in his second year, and he also has a brother studying in a different university.  

Mohammad has applied for this educational loan in order to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 50, married with eight children.  She operates motorcycle transport as a source of income. She has raised her children with her sacrifices and patience.  Her husband helps her through farming. 

Julita wants to improve her motorcycle, and for this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts and for maintenance. Hopefully, with the loan and her strong determination, she will be able to earn enough money to uplift their poor living situation.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and for maintenance

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a married woman with 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Crispina has been in the business of raising hogs for 6 years. She hopes to buy more piglets to raise and improve her income. Crispina also wants to be able to send her children to college. She plans to use her loan to buy additional feeds and piglets. Crispina hopes to be a good businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and piglets

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in her town. She is a 39-year-old married woman with 4 children ages 8, 14, 16 and 19. Her husband is a farmer.

Elma sells various items in her store like canned goods, noodles, vinegar and soy sauce. She earns 4000 PHP per month with this business. Elma’s income is used for her family’s daily needs and she finds it difficult to replenish her inventory immediately. Elma applied for a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. Elma hopes for her sales and income to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 54-year-old married woman with three children, and her husband works as a carpenter.

Elsa has run a sari-sari store for four years, where she sells eggs, softdrinks, spices, and toiletries and earns 2,000 PHP a month. She hopes to improve her income so she can help with her family’s basic needs. She requested a loan to buy merchandise to sell, such as canned goods and softdrinks.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her genearl store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 59 años de edad se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en un sitio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Su idea de negocios comenzó desde hace 6 años vendiendo meriendas y desayunos, a una clínica, que quedaba frente a su negocio. Gradualmente la calidad en la preparación de sus productos fue generándole nuevas oportunidades y una mayor clientela que crecía cada vez más nuevos productos y ella empezó a diversificar su oferta para satisfacer a su clientela y ganar más dinero.   Poco a poco compró mas sillas, adecuó el espacio físico, para albergar mas clientes y con el apoyo de sus hermanas, hoy  ha logrado responder a la demanda. En la actualidad continua con su dinámica de crecimiento pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para adecuar totalmente su estructura, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen, sillas y una estufa con la cual seguir perfeccionando el ejercicio de su actividad y la liquidez de este negocio a corto plazo, le permite afrontar sus obligaciones y responder al potencial de crecimiento al que ella aspira.
texts.en: Nancy is 59 years old.  She prepares and sells food in a location north of the city.  She came up with the idea for her business 6 years ago when she started selling snacks and breakfasts to a clinic located in front of her business.  Gradually, the quality of her products created new opportunities, more customers, and more new products.  She began to diversify her offerings to meet her customers’ needs and earn more money.  Little by little she purchased more chairs, and improved her building space to accommodate more customers.  With the help of her sisters, today she is able to meet demand.  The business is still growing, but she does not have enough capital to totally fix up her space, which is why she has come to Kiva.  This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy ingredients in bulk, and to purchase chairs and a stove which she will use to improve her business and its profitability in the short term.  This will allow her to meet her obligations and support the desired growth potential of her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in bulk quantities, and to buy chairs and a stove.

loans.name: Haydie

texts.en:
Haydie is 36 years old and married with seven children between one and 19 years old. Her husband is a fisherman.

Haydie is also involved in fishing. She helps her husband prepare fishing nets and hooks, and she also sells his catch at the market. She also buys fish from other fishermen. Haydie works hard to support her family. 

She requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and lead weights. Haydie hopes this loan will help improve their fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has run a sari-sari store for four years, where she sells various items like spices, soap, shampoo, softdrinks, and canned goods. She wants to help provide for her family’s basic needs. Maria has three children, ages 3, 8 and 11, and she hopes to continue to educate them and to send them to college in the future.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, softdrinks and toiletries. This will help increase Maria’s sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty decided to start selling dried fish in order to create a better economic situation. This way, she could also save for the educational purposes of her three children. She works every day and puts a lot of effort and will into her business, just to earn enough funds for her family. Her daughters help her when needed but it hurts her to ask.


She doesn’t want her children to feel the difficulties she faces. The hardship of life serves as her inspiration though there are certain times that she weakens. But due to her children, she stands firm. 

To make better sales, Betty is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more dried fish. She hopes to make her business grow in order to uplift their poor living situation.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en: Mateo is a 57-year-old fisherman. He is married with 3 children. Mateo has been involved in fishing for quite some time now. He is able to provide for his family through fishing. Mateo works hard to improve his business and earn better to sustain his family. He requested a loan to purchase additional fishing nets, nylon and bait. Mateo hopes to continue providing for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, nylon and bait

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is patiently operating his piggery business as a source of income. He has two children, who attend school. His business serves as source of funds in sending them, so he wants to improve it to gain higher income. 

So Bienvenido is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamin and two more pigs. Hopefully, with his hard work and the loan, he will be able to earn more money and be able to invest in the development of his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and two more pigs

loans.name: Marly

texts.es: Marly vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus 2 hijas en las edades de 19 a 24 años. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzos y pasteles o amasijos de arroz o harina preparado con verduras,  carnes, y/o pollo y/o cerdo y envuelto en hojas de bijao, en la cual se cocina. Ella también genera ingresos por un negocio de venta de mercancía especialmente productos de belleza. Su negocio nació, continuando la tradición familiar, pues su madre había sacado adelante a su familia, con la venta de los deliciosos pasteles. Por eso Marly al observar el margen de utilidad generado por este negocio, decidió continuarlo y hoy le ha agregado otras actividades ya mencionadas, para aprovechar al máximo su potencial clientela, desde sus compradores actuales. Los fines de semanas venden también sancochos, o sopas con tubérculos variados y tres tipos de carne. Este producto lo vende a una empresa que le paga mensualmente. Su meta es aumentar su volumen de ventas, para continuar con su crecimiento, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para el logro de este propósito y se convierte continuamente en un gran desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará una estufa industrial, para lograr mayor efectividad, materias primas e insumos al por mayor, para ganar descuentos en la venta de los alimentos y productos de belleza que vienen ofertados en catálogos para responder a los pedidos realizados para el día de las madres, fecha en la cual se incrementa su volumen de ventas en todos sus productos. Y esta es justamente la razón del éxito que producirá esta inversión credikivana.
texts.en:
Marly lives in Barranquilla with her husband and two daughters, who are 19 and 24.  She makes lunches, cakes, and dishes with rice or wheat breads and vegetables, meats, chicken, and/or pork wrapped and cooked in bijao leaves. She also has income from selling cosmetics. Her business follows a family tradition, since her mother supported her family by selling delicious cakes. Seeing the profit generated by this business, Marly decided to keep it going and has added the other items mentioned to maximize her business and offer the best selection to her customers. 

On weekends she also sells stews or soups with potatoes and three kinds of meat. She sells these products to a business that pays her monthly. Her goal is to increase sales and continue to grow, but she has insufficient working capital to do so, and this is a continuous challenge. This is the reason she came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first loan. She will use it to buy a more productive industrial stove and to buy wholesale commodities and supplies so that she can get discounts on food products and cosmetics sold through catalogs. She wants to fill cosmetics orders for Mother's Day, when sales for all her products are the highest. And this is also the reason her Kiva investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a more productive industrial stove and to buy wholesale commodities and supplies so that she can get discounts on food products and cosmetics sold through catalogs.

loans.name: Liria

texts.es: Liria de 55 años de edad  de actividad comerciante, vive al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 31 a 37 años. Sus ingresos provienen de la venta de víveres, ranchos, carne,  refresco, tubérculos bulbos y todos los artículos de la canasta familiar que compra con una frecuencia diaria, semanal y mensual de acuerdo con cada proveedor. Sus ventas las realiza al detalle y principalmente son de contado. Su negocio funciona en la sala de su casa desde hace mas de 10 años y con ello responde a sus gastos, pues vive sola, así mismo ella se encarga de su actividad. Su meta mas adelante es independizar su espacio personal de su espacio productivo y por eso trabaja permanentemente con tal de lograr los ingresos para lograrlo. Su mayor desafío para conseguir sus metas de ampliar sus posibilidades productivas  es que no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para estructurarlo tal y como lo sueña. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el fin de lograr un nuevo capital de trabajo para aplicarlo al negocio en la compra de inventarios, lograr un buen surtido y aumentar sus ingresos teniendo mayores inventarios y comprando en mayor volumen. Esta es la razón del éxito de esta inversión kivana.
texts.en: Liria is a 55-year-old saleswoman who lives in the south of the city of Barranquilla.  She has three children who are between 31 and 37 years old.  Liria makes income selling food products, snacks, meat, soft drinks, tubers and other basic household products that she buys daily, weekly or monthly, in agreement with each supplier.  She makes her sales retail and mainly sells for cash.  She has been running her business from her home for more than 10 years and it allows her to cover her expenses.  Liria lives and manages her business alone.  Her goal for the future is to separate her personal space from her business space and she works constantly in order to make the income she needs to achieve this.  Her biggest challenge in achieving her goal is that she does not have enough working capital to structure things in the way she wishes.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) in order to gain new working capital to use in her business.  She will buy merchandise, acquire a good stock of products, increase her income through having more stock and buy in larger volumes.  This is the reason she will succeed with her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a 19-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tracy has requested a loan to pay for farming tools. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Tracy hopes to improve her home and plan for another business.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools to grow taro and bananas

loans.name: Fualilia

texts.en: Fualilia is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling snacks, donuts, pork buns and drinks in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Fualilia has requested a loan to purchase goods for her canteen, e.g., snacks, soft drinks, etc. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fualilia will plan to improve her canteen from the village to sell in public places and to help her children with school fees.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for selling snacks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gloria is single. To make a living, Gloria is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soap and many more. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Gloria is requesting a loan of 17,600 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soap, biscuits, canned goods, and rice to sell. In 2007, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.				.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soap, biscuits, canned goods, and rice to sell

loans.name: Leu

texts.en: Leu is 21 years old and single. She runs a small business selling snacks and ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. Leu has requested a loan to purchase goods and supplies for making ice cakes. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leu will plan to improve her canteen from the village and sell in public places.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making ice cakes and snacks

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is married and has 3 children and he is 45 years old. He resides at Hoyohoy, Tangub City, Philippines.

Enrique raises root crops such as ginger to earn their living and he has been 25 years in this business. Each month, he earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 6,400 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2008, Enrique joined GDMPC. In the future, Enrique wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She sells coconut wine and vinegar to her community. Rosa earns 3,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase more containers and food coloring. Rosa hopes to expand her business in the future. She also hopes to help elevate her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more containers and food coloring

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is separated from his wife and has 2 children. He is 45 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Eddie is operating a retail store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 13 years and every month he earns 1,200 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 2,900 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soap, etc. 

In 2007, Eddie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Eddie hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (drink powder), shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has 4 school-aged children and her husband is a fisherman.

Virgina sells fish for a living. She also makes dried and salted fish to sell to her community. She earns 3000 PHP per month doing this business. She plans to use her loan to buy salt, containers, and more fish to sell. Virginia hopes to be able to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy salt, containers, and more fish to sell

loans.name: John Robert

texts.en:
John Robert is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is still single but hopes to have his own family in the future.

John Robert primarily grows rice crops to sell to his community. He works hard to help support his family and save for his future. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. John hopes to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a married man with 4 children ages 12, 14, 16 and 18. He buys and sells pigs, chickens, and goats. He modified his motorcycle so that delivery will be faster and easier for him. 

Marcos works hard to sustain his family and his children’s education. He requested a loan to buy more pigs, chickens and goats to sell. Marcos hopes to succeed in his business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, chickens and goats to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: A 44-year-old woman with dedication to her business, Victoria is married and has two grown-up children. She manages a personal-products business, selling items such as beauty products. Aside from this business, Victoria manages a store located in front of their house. Victoria requested a loan amounting to 18,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional products such as lotion, soap, cosmetics, and powder to have additional income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy lotion, soap, cosmetics, and powder for her business

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es: Nuris de 43 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 19 años. Ella comercializa productos que promociona mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, negocio que nació  en el año 1995 cuando dejó de trabajar en una empresa y aplicó su liquidación a su propia aventura de negocios.  Ella compró mercanica en otras ciudades de Colombia y empezó a venderla a crédito en Barranquilla, mediante el sistema de crédito. Aunque le fue muy bien muy pronto quedó embarazada y por sugerencia de su esposo dejó de realizar esta actividad , pero así mismo cuando su hijo creció la retomó con mas ganas y con mucha experiencia de vida. Así estuvo vendiendo mediante varias revistas pues llegaron a ofrecérselas en la puerta de su casa y ella con su capacidad de venta fue aumentando su clientela y con ello el volumen de compras. Aunque maneja un pequeño volumen de inventarios le va muy bien, porque todo lo que compra lo vende, especialmente en las temporadas,  como la que se acerca, en la que se conmemora el día de la  madre y el día del padre, épocas en las que su capital de trabajo no le alcanza para cubrir oportunamente sus pedidos y fortalecer sus ingresos. En su negocio sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, familiares y referidos por estos, a quienes vende a crédito para recibir el pago en cuotas quincenales y también compra a crédito, cada 21 días. Su credikiva, es el  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará perfumes, cosméticos, ropa y accesorios en general, con los cuales complacerá los pedidos de sus mas consentidos clientes y ganará cada día un poco mas. Su meta mas adelante es tener vitrinas en las cuales exhiba sus productos y un local bien acondicionado que genere un ambiente confortable para ella y especialmente para su clientela, con ello aspira a obtener ingresos suficientes para ofrecer la posibilidad de que sus hijos estudien en la universidad y se conviertan en personas exitosas.
texts.en:
43-year-old Nuris is a married woman who has three children between the ages of 11 and 19.  Her business is selling products that she promotes through specialist guides or catalogs.  She started this business in 1995 when she stopped working for a company and used her severance pay to start up her own business venture.  She bought merchandise in other cities in Colombia and started selling it on credit in Barranquilla.  Although things went very well, she soon became pregnant and, on her husband's suggestion, stopped working in her business.  However, as her son grew up she started working in the business again with renewed vigor and a lot of life experience.  She sold products through different magazines which she was offered at her door and, as a result of her sales ability, she managed to increase her customer base and also her purchasing power.  Although she sells a small amount of stock, her business does very well because she manages to sell everything she buys, especially during seasons such as the one which is approaching when people celebrate Mother's Day and Father's Day.  At these times of year, she does not have enough working capital to fill her orders in a timely manner and thereby strengthen her income.  In her business, Nuris' main customers are neighbors, family members and people who she has been recommended to.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She also buys on credit every 21 days.

This Kiva loan is Nuris' first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy perfume, cosmetics, clothing and general accessories.  This will enable her to fill the orders of her most faithful customers and she will continue earning a little more.  Her goal for the future is to have display cabinets, in which to display her products, and well-equipped premises that offer her and her customers a comfortable environment.  In this way, she hopes to make enough income that she can offer her children the possibility of studying at university and becoming successful people.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, clothing and general accessories

loans.name: Junaline

texts.en:
Junaline is 28 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a spice retail business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000-Philippine-peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to repack and sell.

Junaline has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spice business for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

Junaline aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to repack and sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
For over six years in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Mildred, a 38-year-old married mother of six children, has made a living buying and selling vegetables. She earns 4,000 pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mildred joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 4,700 pesos to buy more vegetables to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sapa

texts.en: Sapa is 19 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling snacks, donuts, pork buns, and drinks in her community and has been doing this for one year. Sapa has requested a loan to purchase goods for the canteen, e.g., snacks and soft drinks. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sapa plans to expand her canteen from the village to public places like primary school.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her canteen

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es: Luz de 29 años de edad vive en el municipio de soledad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 8 años. Allí se dedica a dos actividades generadoras de ingresos, por un lado vende mercancía variada como ropa, calzado, y por otro lado vende gallina criolla. Ella desde hace 9 años inició vendiendo mercancía, con la cual atendía las necesidades que presentaba su clientela ubicada en su propio barrio. Gradualmente fue abordando los alrededores de este y muy pronto se hizo conocida en los alrededores de él. Sus productos los propone a crédito y a domicilio,con una frecuencia de dos veces por semana, para recuperar su inversión en periodos semanales, quincenales o mensuales, de acuerdo a lo que pacte con uno a uno de sus clientes. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, atendiendo a su recuperación de su cartera y las hace en la ciudad de Barranquilla, a 20 minutos del municipio donde habita. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir su propia vivienda, pero su mayor desafío es tener la disponibilidad de conseguir los recursos suficientes para atender su mercado, crecer empresarialmente y poder cumplir con su sueño. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, cosméticos y gallinas,  con los cuales se prepara para responder a la demanda a propósito de una de las fechas más comerciales del año. “El día de las madres”, época en la cual su clientela quiere sentirse elegante y obsequiar los mejores regalos a un ser maravilloso como lo es la mujer que es madre.
texts.en:
Luz, 29 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad with her husband and their 3 children, ages 1 to 8. Here she dedicates herself to 2 income-generating activities; on the one hand, she sell varied merchandise such as clothes and shoes, and on the other, she sells creole hens. When she was 9 years old, Luz began selling merchandise, attending to the necessities of  customers located in her own barrio. Gradually, she reached the outskirts and, very soon, she became known in surrounding areas.

Luz' products are sold on credit in customers' homes, twice a week. She collects payments weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly, according to what was agreed upon with individual customers. Her purchases are paid for in cash, taking care to cover her accounts, and are made in Barranquilla, some 20 minutes from the municipality where she lives. 

Luz' goal for the future is to acquire her own home, but her biggest challenge is to acquire sufficient resources to attend to her market, to grow as an entrepreneur, and to be able to achieve her dreams. This is why she is seeking a Kiva loan, the 1st financing she has requested through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics and hens. Luz wishes to respond to market demand for one of the biggest commercial days of the year: Mother's Day, a time when her customers want to feel elegant and obtain the best gifts for a marvelous person, the woman who is a mother.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and hens.

loans.name: Angel Sofia

texts.es: Angel de 57 años de edad se dedica a la confección de ropa familiar en su negocio que llama clínica de ropa, porque también ofrece el servicio de ajuste, reparación de ropa. Su negocio lo inició hace muchos años, con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos, para ayudar al sostenimiento de su hogar. En la actualidad sus planes de crecimiento no han cesado y necesita crecer en clientela y en infraestructura. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a solicitar un crédito mixto, con el cual comprar una maquinaria para darle mayor efectividad a sus procesos y también comprará materias primas con las cuales elaborar nuevos diseños, que ya tiene encargados. Su meta mas adelante es tener una casa propia y prosperar con su taller generando empleos para operarias, que le ayuden a ampliar el tamaño de su mercado. Su  mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograrlo y con su credikiva, muy pronto comenzará su camino a la prosperidad tan anhelada.
texts.en:
Angel, 57, makes clothing for the family in her business that she calls Clínica de Ropa [Clothing Clinic] because she also offers fitting and mending.  She started her business many years ago with the goal of generating her own income to help support the household.  Currently her plans for growth have not ceased, and she needs to grow in clientele and infrastructure.

This is why she is coming to request a mixed loan with which to buy a machine to make her methods more effective.  She also will buy raw materials to make new designs for which she already has orders.

Her long-term goal is to have her own house and prosper with her shop, generating jobs for operators to help her expand the size of her market.  Her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to achieve this.

With her Kiva loan, she will begin the road to prosperity that she so desires.

loans.use: to buy a machine and raw materials in large quantities.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira  de 53 años de edad vive con su cónyuge en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 16 a 32 años. Ella es la propietaria de un taller de confecciones que inició hace 20 años con una máquina sencilla que recuerda haber comprado a crédito,  en un precio de $500.000 COP . Inicialmente confeccionaba para familiares, pero poco a poco, sus vecinos se fueron enterando y allí empezó a desarrollar la actividad como negocio. Actualmente cuenta con dos máquinas industriales y tiene un gran empeño en ampliar su infraestructura técnica, para lograr mejorar los tiempos productivos. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  una maquina de coser semielectrica de 7 hilos, para mejorar el acabado de sus prendas y con ello logrará una mayor satisfacción de su clientela. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio almacén de ropa diseñada y fabricada en su taller y su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para invertir, aumentar su mercado y generar mayores ingresos que aumentes su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Elvira, 53, lives with her spouse in the city of Barranquilla and has four children whose ages range from 13 to 32.  She owns a sewing workshop that she started twenty years ago with a simple sewing machine she remembers having bought on credit for five-hundred thousand Colombian pesos.  Initially she sewed for family members but gradually her neighbors started to find out and this was when she started to develop as a business.

She currently has two industrial machines and very much wants to expand her technical infrastructure to attain better productive efficiency which is precisely why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a semi-electric, seven-thread sewing machine to better finish her articles of clothing to attain better customer satisfaction.

Her goal for later on is to have her own store with clothing designed and manufactured in her shop and her greatest challenge is to have sufficient working capital to invest, to increase her market share and to generate higher income to increase her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a semi-electric, seven-thread sewing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fredolyn

texts.en: Fredolyn, a 37-year-old loving and hardworking mother of two grown-up children, is married to Gilbert and lives in the village of Luna, province of Isabela. She has managed a store in their community for five years. To expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional products, such as snack foods, canned goods, sugar, and rice for her store. She dreams to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, sugar, and rice for her store

loans.name: El Mana Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal El Mana está conformado por ocho emprendedoras que se han unido para forma este grupo y apoyarse unas a otras, se brinda ideas nuevas para sus negocios y salir adelante con cada uno de sus negocios. Este grupo de emprendedoras tienen objetivos bien definido que es de engrandecer su negocio teniendo siempre productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es la primera vez que este grupo está solicitando financiamiento, la emprendedora  Ilda Victoria es parte de este grupo su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes con el crédito comprara granos básicos, aceite, jabón, pan, pasta de diente, cepillos de dientes, detergente entre otros productos que más demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “El Mana” communal bank is composed of 8 entrepreneurs who have joined together to form this group and support each other, come up with new ideas for their businesses and to get ahead with each of their businesses.  This group of entrepreneurs has well defined goals which are to enlarge their business always having products available for their customers.  This is the first time this group is asking for financing.

Ilda Victoria is part of this group and her economic activity is a grocery store she has installed at home where she tends to customers.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains, oil, soap, bread, toothpaste, tooth brushes and detergent, among other products that have the highest customer demand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Stefany

texts.es: Stefany de 22 años de edad tiene  un negocio mediante el cual ofrece  al público el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras y también desarrolla otra actividad donde vende productos cosméticos mediante catálogos, ambas actividades complementan el ingreso de su familia. Su negocio lo inició en compañía de su madre, con el fin de apoyar los gastos de su hogar y lograr dar continuidad de sus estudios. Su primer capital fue de $300.000 COP y gradualmente ha crecido y con su esmerado trabajo, continúa en esta misma directriz. Su mayor desafío es lograr el suficiente capital de trabajo para poder cumplir sus sueños de ampliarlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará lavadoras y productos de belleza, que tiene encargados por sus mas asiduos clientes. Con ello aumentará su potencial de ventas y así mismo tendrá un fondo de efectivo para financiar su cartera de cuentas por cobrar. Su meta mas adelante es independizar su espacio familiar del comercial,  ya que toda la sala la ocupa el negocio con las máquinas para lavar y así no es posible lograr el tan anhelado sosiego familiar.
texts.en:
Stefany, 22, has a business by means of which she offers the public washing machine rental service; she also has a second activity which is selling beauty products via catalogue.  Both activities contribute to family income.

She started her business with her mother aiming at helping with household expenses and to be able to continue with her studies.  Her initial capital was 300,000 Colombian pesos which gradually grew with her dedication to work; she’s continuing in this same direction.

Her greatest challenge is having sufficient working capital to meet her dreams of expanding it and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy washing machines and beauty products she has pending orders for from her best customers.  With this she’ll increase her sales potential while also having a supply of cash to cover her accounts payable.

Her goal for later on is to separate her commercial space from her residential space because her entire living room is taken up by the washing machines which does not lead to family tranquility that is so desired.

loans.use: to buy washing machines and beauty products.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Dios Proveerá está conformado por nueve emprendedores que se unieron para salir adelante y apoyarse unos a otros son de la misma localidad, cada uno de los emprendedores tienen sus negocios y tienen metas en su negocios de crecer cada día, ellos se apoyan y se brindan consejos que le permita ser mejores. Luz Idalia es una emprendedora que es parte de este grupo y su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cerdos sus cliente ya son fijos a los cuales les ofrece su producto, esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar cerdos y alimentos para la animales.
texts.en:
The Dios Proveerá (God Will Provide) Communal Bank is made up of nine entrepreneurs from the same town who came together in order to get ahead in life and to support each other.  Each of the entrepreneurs have their own businesses, and have goals in their business to grow each day.  They support each other and offer advice that allows them to get better.  

Luz Idalia is an entrepreneur who is part of this group, and the business that she makes a living with is selling pigs.  The customers to which she offers her products are already regulars.  This entrepreneur is asking for a financial loan to buy pigs and food for the animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for the animals.

loans.name: Yadira Berlea

texts.es: Yadira Berlea tiene 60 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de licor ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes les ofrece su producto, esta emprendedora tiene hijos que la apoyan económicamente pero que no están a su cargo, está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar diferentes tipos de  licores para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Yadira Berlea is 60 years old. She sells liquors and she offers her product both to her fixed customers and to the occasional ones. She can count on the economic support of her children, who are also independent and do not live with her. She is requesting a loan to buy various brands of liquors to offer them to her customers.

loans.use: To buy various brands of liquors.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  Helen works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.  She also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Helen is requesting her seventh loan for 10,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to buy additional items to sell.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, représentante du groupe de crédit Amkeni, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur,  âgée de 30 ans, mère de 3 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle propriétaire des taxis motos. En plus, elle est  infirmière de formation.  Son mari est un professeur dans une école de technique médicale de la place. Elle commença son business avec son salaire lors qu’elle travaillait à la Commission électorale indépendante (CEI) vers les années 2006. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et habillement pour sa famille. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  6eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires marchent positivement malgré la crise qui pointe a l’horizon. Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des équipements ménagers importants pour sa famille. Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter une nouvelle moto pour ses activités de taxi. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en bonne santé. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: The customer, who is the representative of the Amkeni loan group, is a courageous woman and an entrepreneur. She is 30 years old and mother to three children, who are all at school. She owns moto-taxis and is also a nurse by trade. Her husband is a teacher in a local medical technology school. She began her business with her salary when she was working at the Independent Electoral Commission (CEI) around 2006. The profits she makes from her business are put into her savings, and also used for food and clothing for her family. Meanwhile, she has just been granted her sixth loan. During this period, this customer's business has worked well, despite the crisis on the horizon. Thanks to the loans from Hekima she has bought significant household goods for the family. This new loan will be used to buy a new motorbike for her taxi business. Moreover, she would like to see her children grow up healthily. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions to make poor women with low incomes more autonomous. It should be noted that the customer is holding her baby in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Auxiliadora su actividad  económica desde hace cinco años es la venta de mercadería en general, esta emprendedora inicio dicha actividad para tener una herramienta de trabajo y así poder ayudar económicamente con los gastos de su familia, en la actualidad gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado con los financiamientos ha cumplidos con sus sueños y metas, crecer en el mercado y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela con los diferentes productos que ofrece como : zapatos,camisas sport, camisas de vestir,calcetines, pantaletas, pañuelos,blusas, entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora has been selling goods in general for five years. This entrepreneur started this activity in order to have a job to economically help her family with the payment of their expenses. Thanks to the help received by Fundación León 2000 through the loans, she has succeeded in making her dreams come true: she has grown in the market and she has been able to satisfy her customer’s requests with the different products she sells, such as shoes, athletic shirts, dress shirts, socks and underwear, scarfs, & blouses.

loans.use: to buy shoes, athletic shirts, dress shirts, socks and underwear, scarfs, & blouses

loans.name: Liseth
