loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en: Faatupu is 50 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells earrings, elei printing on fabric, Samoan kava bowls, etc to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Faatupu has requested a loan to purchase material for the business. She plans to use her profits to pay her children school fees,and renovate her house. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 41 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Felix buys and sells coconut shells. Felix been in his business for 20 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Felix joined GDMPC. Felix is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more coconut shells to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Soknhean

texts.en:
Soknhean, age 28, is single. He lives with his parents and brother in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Soknhean is a Khmer literature teacher. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his brother to use to get to work. Soknhean’s brother works in Phnom Penh, however because his home is quite far from the city, he needs to stay with his aunt after work. With a motorbike which he will buy with money from the loan, he will be able to come back home every evening to help his mother at home. 


Photo: Soknhean is standing in front of the motorcycle which he wanted to buy for his brother because he bought it, but he did not pay the money yet. So, he asks for the loan to pay for purchasing.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his brother to get work.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, age 33, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Chamroeun, age 30, is a garment worker, and they have been married since 2005 and just have one young daughter. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thea hopes to change his business from motor taxi driver to Tuk Tuk driver, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence, Thea decided to apply for his first loan in the amount of $600 to add to his own money to buy a Tuk Tuk.       

Photo: Thea is standing next to the Tuk Tuk which he wanted to buy because he bought it, but he did not pay any money yet. So, he asks for the loan to pay for purchasing.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a "Tuk Tuk".

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun (in the photo), age 42, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Vanny, is a tailor. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have four children--two sons and two daughters. All of their children are attending school.

Moeun is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,300 to buy a motorbike for his children to use to get to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to use to get to school.

loans.name: Siomara Velmina

texts.es:
Siomara es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, junto a su esposo tienen 2 pequeños de 3 y 9 años a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por los cuales da la vida por sacarlos adelante ya que son el mejor regalo que Dios le ha dado; su esposo siempre la apoya en todo y sobre todo es su mano derecha, el trabaja como obrero en el campo y también como pescador y junto a Siomara aportan para los gastos de hogar; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener hermosas playas, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz y también tiene como actividad la pesca. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con sus pequeños y también le gusta disfrutar en algunas oportunidades de su platillo favorito el cual es el Pescado al vapor.

Día a día Siomara sale a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en la pequeña bodega que tiene en su vivienda; ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y su carisma para la venta.

Siomara está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, menestras, entre otros, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y tendrá mayor variedad de productos lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”
texts.en:
Siomara is a very hard-working and enthusiastic woman, who has two young children with her husband.  They are aged 3 and 9, and she loves them very much.  She dedicates her life to moving them ahead in life, as they are the greatest gift that God has given her.  Her husband helps her with everything, and above all is her right hand.  He works as a laborer in the fields, and also as a fisherman.  Together with Siomara, he shares in covering the household expenses.  Their home is located in the city of Camana, a city which is characterized by its beautiful beaches; its agriculture, especially rice farming; and also its fishing.  When Siomara has free time, she very much enjoys going for walks with her young children.  She also likes to enjoy her favorite dish, which is steamed fish.

On a daily basis, Siomara goes to work in her business with much enthusiasm, selling groceries from the small store she has in her home.  She works around twelve hours a day, and can serve up to 30 customers a day.  She believes that things are going well for her with her business because she is very friendly to her customers and uses charisma in making her sales.

Siomara is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support that they have provided her, she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and beans among other things.  In this way she will be able to improve her income and stock a greater variety of products.  This will allow her to continue working and continue striving on a daily basis to make her most important dream a reality: "To be able to build her home out of fine materials"

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, and noodles, among other things).

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 58 years old and married with four children. He earns about PHP 35,000 per crop season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Ferdinand grows rice and has been doing this for 30 years. Ferdinand is asking for a loan of PHP 48,000 to buy farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for the proper growth of his rice production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business and to be able to continue providing his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is married with one child. She is 21 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Claire used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio resides at Capatan, near Tuguegrarao City, with his wife and child.  To earn a living, the couple raises hogs, breeding them and fattening them to sell upon attaining the desired growth.  In addition to the hog raising business, they also own a hectare plot of land, which they cultivate by planting rice.  They have been working in their businesses for 10 years and earn about 10,000 PHP each month.

Dionicio aims to strengthen the hog raising business in order to earn a higher income.  Therefore he is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed, medicine and vaccines to sustain his hogs.

He hopes to continue generating good profits from both businesses in order to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vaccines to sustain his hogs.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio lives in Capatan.  He is 44 years old and has one child.  Dionicio's spouse operates a retail store to add to his income, which is derived from providing motorcycle transport services to the people in the village where they live.  

He has been in the transport service for 10 years.  He generates good income from his business and it is just enough to meet all his family's needs.  He is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP in order to improve his business.  He will buy tires, gasoline and crude oil for the motorcycle's maintenance.

Through hard work, patience and continuous profits in their businesses, they hope to progress and improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline and crude oil for the motorcycle's maintenance.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s grocery store business. 
 
With the loan investment, he will put larger stock of different grocery items such as sugar, salt, spices, etc. at his shop which will allow him to fill the orders of his clients and increase his sales and profits.  

Tahira is very supportive in nature and supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She has given birth to 4 sons and 2 daughters. Her daughters also sew clothes and help Tahira complete the clients' orders on time.  

She is a very hardworking lady and hopeful about the better future of her family as a result of her husband’s business improvement.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan is a mother of 6 sons. All of them remain at home and don’t do anything. Due to financial constraints, Shareefan couldn’t provide them with an education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who sells wheat and other agricultural produce. He purchases this agricultural produce from different farmers and sells it at a profit.  

With the loan investment, he will buy wheat, rice, etc. in larger quantity that will allow him to fill larger orders on time and increase his profits.  He has been operating his business for the past many years and is well-known for his good behavior and professional attitude.  

Shareefan is confident that his business will further improve after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy wheat & rice for resale

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru:
Гулбарчын 28 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Гулбарчын в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2002 года занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Продажа картофеля и кукурузы приносит около 80,000 сом (KGS) в год. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулбарчын обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минерального удобрения.  Доходы от кредита Гулбарчын планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulbarchyn is 28 years old, married and raising three children.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in farming since 2002, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Sales of potatoes and corn yield about 80,000 som (KGS) per year.  In order to further develop her business, Gulbarchyn requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy mineral fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Abiba

texts.ru: Абибе 47 лет. В 2007 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Абиба начала свой бизнес в торговле овощами со стартовой суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Абиба сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Абиба  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Абиба  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Abiba is 47 years old.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business of selling vegetables in 2007 with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Abiba was able to grow her business to yield a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today her product selection is limited, and this is why Abiba requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business.

loans.use: to expand product selection

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 61 years old.  She is a widow and has four children.

Dominga raises hogs, breeding them and fattening them to sell to butchers upon maturity.  She has been in this business for over five years now.  She earns about 7,000 PHP from each hog she sells.  She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy feed and vaccines to sustain her hogs.  With this loan, she will be able to ensure good growth and nutrition for her hogs and increase her net profit upon their sale. 

In the future, Dominga hopes to establish a continuous profit stream in order to save funds for use in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 56 years old and is married with five children. Gregoria is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns about PHP 30,000 every crop season.

Gregoria is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers, seedlings and to pay for labor needed for rice-planting. She and her family believe that this loan will be an enormous help to their hopes of increasing their yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and to pay for labor needed for rice-planting

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is a farmer working in the Philippines. He is 38 years old and is married with two children. Ariel works hard to uplift his family from poor living. He has been in this business for 13 years and usually earns about PHP 32,000 per harvest season. 

Right now, Ariel is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting rice. Ariel believes that through his loan, his business will  grow further and  help him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting rice

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny is 34 years old and is married to Doris. He and his family live happily in a village and have a plan to raise their standard of living. Farming is one of their major sources of income; they plant and harvest rice for sale. They have been in this business for more than seventeen years and usually earn a profit of PHP 30,000 in each harvest season. 

At this time, Manny is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for the labor needed for rice-planting. Manny believes that this loan will be an enormous help to their hopes of increasing their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for the labor needed for rice-planting

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 31 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Ester is a farmer working in the Philippines. She has been in her business for over five years and earns about PHP 35,000 every time she harvests rice for sale.

At this time, Ester is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her rice production. Ester knows that the land will always provide a good harvest if you work hard enough.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her rice production

loans.name: Bashiran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran bibi is 58 years old and married. In this relationship, she has five children: three daughters and two sons. 

Her husband is a painter by profession. He paints walls and buildings on contract. He gets the money when he finishes the orders. His work is not permanent. Sometimes he gets work and sometimes not.  

To support her husband financially, Bashiran operates a boutique business. She prepares dresses to display to her clients for selling. She has been operating her business for over five years. Bashiran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her boutique business. She will invest the loan in buying of clothes, beads, laces and threads in larger quantity to prepare better quality and better-looking dresses to sell.. She is confident about the financial success of her business after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes, beads, laces and thread for her boutique business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, age 61, would like to increase the profit she earns every day. So, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy bananas and vegetables needed by her customers. She provides friendly service to her customer and that’s why an old woman keeps acquiring customers.

She is very industrious and humble, which may cause other people to like her and keep on buying her products. She just hopes that her business will continue to grow in order to save for her family

loans.use: to buy bananas and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zaryl

texts.ru:
Зарыл 58 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Зарыл на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Зарыл в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овцы и 10 коз. Прибыль с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарыл обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку жеребят.  Доходы от кредита Зарыл планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zaryl is 58 years old, married and has five children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 30 years, having started this business with a sum of 10,000 som.  Thanks to Zaryl's hard work, today her business contains two cows, two horses, ten sheep and ten goats.  The profit from sales of milk and milk products amounts to about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Zaryl requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy colts.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase colts

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Gloria has been raising livestock for 4 years and also earns additional income from duck raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita works hard to support her family. Isabelita is married and buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Isabelita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Isabelita has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 42 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leonida has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, biscuits, canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future Leonida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Crindy

texts.es: Crindy de 28 años, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de un año de edad al sur de la ciudad. Ella en su propia casa,  tiene un taller de confecciones  como negocio principal y también genera utilidades mediante la venta de carnes frías, lo cual complementa sus ingresos familiares. Su negocio lo inició desde hace tres años,  con la compra que hizo de una  maquina plana, producto de su liquidación obtenida cuando trabajaba en la Zona Franca de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde obtuvo su más apreciada experiencia,  que posteriormente tradujo en su actividad independiente de hoy.  Sus principales productos son sabanas y ropa de cama, así como también trabaja la línea femenina de vestidos y  los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de carnes frías, que compra para vender entre los vecinos de su sector y con el  cual  le ha ido muy bien. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el que comprará materias primas e insumos de confección y también le invertirá en su otro negocio de carnes frías, que se esta posicionando entre sus clientes y le genera ingresos complementarios, con los que beneficia aun mas su hogar. Su meta mas adelante, es tener una infraestructura de taller, con operarias y poder alcanzar un mercado mayor, que le permita cumplir con el sueño de que su hijo,  logre en el futuro  estudios profesionales. Su mayor desafío es que el espacio de su casa,  no es suficiente para lograr su crecimiento,  un ambiente de trabajo mas confortable  y que solo  con su capital de trabajo no puede alcanzar sus metas  futura, por lo cual ha recurrido a su credikiva, con el que auguramos éxito en su inversión,  en términos de que es experta en la técnica de confecciones y en el mercado en el que actúa.
texts.en:
Crindy, aged 28, lives in the south of the city with her husband and one-year-old son.  She has a sewing workshop in her home, which is her main business, and she also earns money through selling cold cuts, with which she adds to her family income.  She started her business three years ago with the purchase of a sewing machine, which she purchase with the severance that she obtained from working in the French Zone in Barranquilla city.  This is where she gained her most valued experience which she later turned into her current independent business.

Her main products that she makes are sheets and bed linens, and she also makes a line of women's clothing.  On the weekends, she works selling cold cuts, which she purchases in order to sell to her neighbors.  This has gone very well for her. 

She is currently preparing to receive a Kiva loan, which will be her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to purchase raw materials and supplies for sewing, and also will invest it in her other business of cold cuts to position herself with her customers and earn additional income which will help her household even more.

Her goal for later on is to have infrastructure for her workshop and operators, and to be able to reach a better marketplace.  This would allow her to achieve her dream for her son, which is for him to be able to undertake professional studies.  Her major challenge is that the space in her house is not sufficient to allow for growth and a more comfortable working environment.  With only her own working capital, she cannot achieve her goals for the future, which is why she has come for a Kiva loan.  The lender anticipates a successful investment as Crindy is an expert in the technical side of sewing and in the marketplace in which she operates.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies for sewing. and cold cuts to bolster her other business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shorooq

texts.en:
Shorooq is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ja'far appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured inside their house.

Shorooq is a 20-year-old woman, married to Ja'far and a mother to one son. Her husband works in a bakery and gets low salary which is not enough to cover all their needs.

Shorooq suffers from moisture in her house, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing the necessary materials to repair the moisture and purchasing paint for painting the entire house. This will improve the house's condition and offer Shorooq and her family healthy living conditions at home.

loans.use: To pay for the necessary materials for repairing and painting their house

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 65 years old, married with 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 50 years old and married with 8 children. With 4 children in school, Lucy works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. Lucy has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, soft drinks, snack foods, etc.. 

In the future, Lucy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Elena is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs. Maria Elena has been pig fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 51 years old, married with two children. She is a friendly person who operates a sari-sari business. She wakes up early in the morning to prepare her store in order to acquire higher sales every day. 

To satisfy the needs of her customers, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional products such as canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. She hopes that her business will expand so that she can meet all the needs of her family, especially to her children.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as canned goods, noodles and soft drinks

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and lives in the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of two children. Lorna has a food vending business to earn a living. Her main source of income comes from selling barbecued food in her community. She has been in this type of business for 26 years. She earns 6,000 PHP each month from these activities. 

Lorna has requested a loan of 11,300 PHP from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients to barbecue and purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation. She has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her barbecue vending and have a stall in the city for food vending.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to barbecue and purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a married woman with three children. She has a retail shop, and has been in the business for 5 years now and gets a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to stock the shop with sugar, flour, and sodas for sale. With the profits, she wants to start producing ice blocks for sale. In the future, Stella wants to upgrade the kiosk to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and sodas

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old. Lucita is married and has 7 children. To make a living, she manages a business planting and harvesting seaweeds for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Lucita joined GDMPC. Lucita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy seedlings and twine to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and twine to expand the business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is married with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 38 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for fishing and for maintenance of her fishing boat.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for fishing and maintenance of fishing boat

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling spices and vegetables  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Melanie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her spices and vegetables business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Mercedita has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mercedita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Novelyn has been in this business for 3 years. Novelyn earns more income from pig fattening.

Novelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Rohita

texts.en:
Rohita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

Rohita has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Rohita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 49 years old and married.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from cooked food vending.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Josè Benigno

texts.es:
José  es un hombre que tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. José vive en casa propia en el caserío Sonolipe del distrito de Motupe  del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 80 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica José  es el comercio, de ganado vacuno, además de la  crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral,  la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad José cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente José se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la comercialización, engorde y venta de animales (vacunos y animales menores), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado  a la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde, ya que cuenta con sembrìo de pasto  y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida; y además en este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que el titular cuenta con clientela ya establecida.
texts.en:
José is a 42-year-old single man who lives with his parents in his own home.  He mentions that the quality of life in his community is subsistence living.  The majority of residents work for themselves selling things or raising small animals, and some of them also work in agriculture.

José lives in his own home in the village of Sonolipe in Motupe district in the department of Lambayeque; he only has basic electrical service, and water is provided through an artesanal well.  He also mentions that about 80 families live in this village under these conditions.

The retailing activity that José  works in is selling cattle.  He also raises, fattens and sells small animals such as farmyard poultry.  He raises these animals in the pens outside his home, however he sells them in the local market which has wholesaler animal purchasers.  It is worth noting that José has five years of experience in this field, which has allowed him to keep the customer base he has established with his business.

Currently José has proposed to expand his inventory for his business of fattening and selling animals (cattle and small animals).  This is a very profitable activity in his neighborhood, which is why he is requesting a new loan for the sum of 1,000 new soles.  This will be allocated for the purchase of cattle for fattening, as he has planted pasture land, and will also be used to improve his animals' pens.  In time, this will allow him to improve his standard of living.  Furthermore, there isn't any major competition in this field in his neighborhood, and he has an already established customer base.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Abed Al Ghani

texts.en:
Abed Al Ghani is a 35-year-old married man, father of one child. Abed Al Ghani has been working in furniture-making for 22 years, experience enough for gaining customers' trust & support.

Abed Al Ghani was only 12 years old when he started working, in order to help his family in making their living. He missed out on childhood since he didn't have the chance to enjoy being a child.

In 1995, Abed Al Ghani opened his own business and it's getting on just fine. Abed Al Ghani only needs cash to update  his tools to make sure that they are number one quality products. That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary tools requested. He hopes to keep on improving his business as much as he can and to provide his family the best living.

loans.use: To buy neccessary tools for his business

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is 31 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his mother. Mirian and his mother grow maize on a family-owned plot of land. They sell harvested maize on the local open market. Mirian has chronic health problems and he gets a relevant pension from the government. According to the local government the family belongs to the subsistence poor category and they receive social assistance. Total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris, including pension and social assistance. 

Mirian requested credit for the start-up of a small dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with easy conditions for country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Mirian will start up a dairy farm. He will purchase a milk cow and place it in an old cattle-shed, located in his yard. Mirian and his mother will start production of cheese and sell it on the local market to dairy products retailers. The monthly income of the family will increase by 200 Laris, which will mean 80%. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Sandra has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 7 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Sandra aspires to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 26-year-old married man, father of two children. Four years ago, Fadel opened his own mobile phone shop and has improved it a lot since that time, but the family needs require a lot more effort and investment, to cover requested issues.

That's why, Fadel has applied for the first time for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy newly released mobile phones which are highly requested by most of his clients.

Fadel is a hard worker, and his shop is located in a very important spot in his village. Most of his customers are friends, relatives and neighbors, in addition to some passing tourists during the spring & summer seasons.

loans.use: To buy newly released mobile phones

loans.name: San Juan Masias Group

texts.es:
El grupo “SAN JUAN MASIAS” tiene 05 socias, una de ellas es la Sra. Delma. Ella tiene 47 años es casada con 02 hijos, antes se dedicaba al cuidado de sus hijos pero fue una amiga quien la animo a vender productos de belleza   empezó con la intención de lograr un ingreso adicional para su familia y por qué lo haría en sus ratos libres, sin descuidar a sus hijos; al principio vendía muy poco pero con el paso del tiempo sus ventas aumentaron junto con los pedidos de sus clientas. Ahora ofrece varias marcas del mercado, aparte de eso también compra otros productos que ofrece junto a los de belleza, con su préstamo comprara relojes, joyas de fantasía y otros accesorios de mujer que son muy requeridos, los ingresos por su trabajo son de mucha ayuda para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y también pudo comprarse algunos artefactos para su casa, para mas adelante sus hijos la quieren apoyar para poner un bazar de regalos en su casa. 
* Delma es la segunda de la derecha; viste polo morado.
* La foto en la parte inferior central corresponde al Señor Rommel.
texts.en:
The San Juan Masias Group has five members.  One of the members is Delma who is 47 years old, and married with two children.  Previously, she was dedicated to the care of her children but a friend encouraged her to sell beauty products.  She began with the intention of earning additional income for her family because she would be able to do it during her spare time, without neglecting her children.  At first, she sold very little, but with time, her sales and customer requests grew.  Now, she offers various market brands and besides that, she also offers other items for sale in addition to her beauty products.  With the loan, she will purchase watches, costume jewelry, and other ladies’ accessories that are very popular.  The income she earns from her job is a big help in supporting her children with their studies and also enables her to buy other articles for her house.  Later on, her children want to help her install a gift bizarre in her home.  

Delma is the second from the right in the purple shirt.
The small photo at the bottom is Mr. Rommel.

loans.use: to purchase watches and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Angamos Group

texts.es:
La  Sra. Jessica  es  madre  de  2 niños  a  pesar de que su esposo trabaja,  muchas veces el dinero no alcanza por ese motivo decidió empezar un negocio en su misma casa,  ella tiene una bodega donde vende diversos productos; también prepara gelatinas y helados artesanales, por las noches vende anticuchos (plato típico peruano) muchas personas de su zona acuden a consumir los alimentos que prepara ya que es muy conocida por su buena sazón. Ella quiere seguir ahorrando para abrir un restaurante donde se pueda dedicar  a la venta de comidas, con su préstamo comprara gaseosas al por mayor para surtir su negocio. La Sra. Jessica tiene cerca de 1 año perteneciendo al grupo” MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANGAMOS “ donde es la tesorera.
 *Jessica es la primera de la izquierda viste pantalón lila.
 *La foto del lado derecho corresponde a la señora María que no pudo asistir para la foto por encontrarse un poco delicada de salud.
texts.en:
Jessica has two children.  In spite of the fact that her husband works, there are many times that there is not enough money.  That is why she decided to start a business in her house.

She has a general store where she sells diverse products.  She also prepares gelatin and homemade ice cream.  In the evenings she sells “anticuchos” (typical Peruvian dish).  A lot of people in her area come to eat the food she prepares because she is well-known for her good cooking.

She wants to continue saving in order to open a restaurant where she would be able to devote herself to selling meals.  She will use her loan to buy soft drinks wholesale in order to stock her business.

Jessica has belonged to the “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Angamos” (Enterprising Women of Angamos) for almost one year, and she is the treasurer.

*Jessica is wearing lilac colored  pants and is on the left.
* The picture on the right side is of Sra. Maria who could not be present for health reasons.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk for her business

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en:
Yehya is a 23-year-old married man who opened a grocery store in 2008. Yehya is a hard working man with a good reputation. Most of Yehya's customers are neighbors, friends, relatives and passersby. His store needs support, which is why Yehya applied for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. With this loan, Yehya will increase his business stock with special spring/summer requested items.

Yehya hopes to improve his business more and more in order to improve his family's living conditions and to expand his business in the near future.This is his first experience with Al Majmoua and he hopes it will sprout success in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 26 years old and she lives in Yerevan. She works at the court as a conference secretary. Emma’s husband is a fourth-year student at Armenian State Agricultural University. He is studying by correspondence in the accounting and audit department. Emma is asking for a 180.000 AMD loan to pay for her husband’s education fees. Emma says that her husband will start to work as a military man in the near future. Emma has a one-year-old daughter and her parents-in-law live with Emma and her young family.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s education

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for to maintain her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Amina has been in this business for seven years. Amina earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

Amina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Sumsarkan

texts.ru:
Сумсаркан 51 год, вдова, имеет 3 детей. Сумсаркан с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Сумсаркан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы, 2 теленка, 30 овец и 5 коз. Прибыль с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сумсаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят и овец.  Доходы от кредита Сумсаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Sumsarkan is 51 years old, a widow, and has three children. Sumsarkan has been engaged in livestock breeding since 2000, having started this business with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Sumsarkan currently has 2 cows, 2 calves, 30 sheep and 5 goats on her farm. The income from selling milk and dairy products is around 8,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sumsarkan turned to the organization Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves and sheep. Sumsarkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru:
Жылдызкан 49 лет, вдова, имеет 2 детей. Жылдызкан с 1993 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы, 10 овец и 2,50 га земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картофель. Прибыль с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку коровы.  Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Jyldyzkan is 49 years old, a widow, and has two children. Jyldyzkan has been engaged in livestock breeding since 1993, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Jyldyzkan's farm currently has 2 cows, 10 sheep and 2.5 hectares of land, where she grows haricots and potatoes. The income from selling milk and dairy products is around 3,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Jyldyzkan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows. Jyldyzkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bella Rosa

texts.en:
Bella Rosa is 62 years old and married with three children.

Bella Rosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Bella Rosa has borrowed and paid back 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for eight years and earns additional income from selling rice.

Bella Rosa aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 45 years old and has seven children. Eloisa is married and three of her children are in school.

Eloisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Eloisa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eloisa has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eloisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bujamal

texts.ru:
Бужамал 43 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Бужамал с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки овец. Благодаря упорному труду Бужамал в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы и 18 овец. Прибыль с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бужамал обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка – телят и ягнят.  Доходы от кредита Бужамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Bujamal is 43 years old, married, and has 5 children. Bujamal has been engaged in livestock breeding since 1995, having started this business by buying sheep. Thanks to persistent work, Bujamal currently has 3 cows and 18 sheep on her farm. The income from selling milk and dairy products is around 30,000 com (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Bujamal turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of young livestock - calves and lambs. Bujamal plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock - calves and lambs

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru:
Чынаркул 48 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Чынаркул на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 500 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы, 8 лошадей и 15 овец. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Чынаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Chynarkul is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Chynarkul has been engaged in livestock breeding for a period of 20 years, having started this business with a sum of 500 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Chynarkul currently has 3 cows, 8 horses and 15 sheep on her farm. The sale of milk and dairy products brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Chynarkul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows, that will allow her to increase the milk production. Chynarkul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to increase milk production

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es: Yesenia es una joven de 23 años de edad originaria de Nueva Segovia actualmente vive en Estelí, madre de un hijo, casada, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de alquiler de nintendo actividad que es un entretenimiento para los niños de la zona que llegan a jugar con los videos juegos que les ofrece Yesenia. Inicio su actividad a la edad de 21 años con dinero propio ya que antes trabajaba en un restaurante y de  los ahorro que tenia decidió poner su negocio en el que recibe el apoyo del esposo, cuenta con otros ingreso ya que ella  trabaja como cajera. Solicita el préstamo para comprar televisores, play station y controles para el negocio. Ella estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá satisfacer la demanda de la clientela, los niños quienes son los que mas le demandan tener lo que esta de moda en video juegos . Esta inversion le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, sus planes futuros es crecer en su negocio para ofrecerle un mejor nivel económico a su hijo, sus metas próximas es poder comprar mas televisores de las ganancias que le genere el negocio y tener su casa propia para un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a 23-year-old young woman from Nueva Segovia. She currently lives in Estelí. She is married and has one son. She has a business where she rents nintendo video games, which are entertainment for the children who live in her area who are able to play with the video games that Yesenia offers. She started her business when she was 21 years old with her own money. Before that she worked in a restaurant. With the savings that she had she decided to start a business with support from her husband. She also has other income as she works as a cashier.

She is requesting this loan to purchase televisions, a PlayStation and controllers for her business. She believes that the loan will help her because she will be able to meet her the demand of her customers, the children children who most often ask her for the video games that are all the rage.

This investment will enable her to increase her income. Her plans for the future are to grow her business so that she can offer a higher standard of living to her son. Her goals for the near future are to purchase more televisions with her profits from her business and to live in her own home that she can have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase televisions, a PlayStation and controllers for her business.

loans.name: Abed Al Nabi

texts.en:
Abed Al Nabi is a19-year-old single man who opened in 2007 his own wood factory. Abed Al Nabi is a hard working man with a very good reputation, who puts so much effort into improving and expanding his business to almost make all of his dreams come true.

Abed Al Nabi is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to pay for a special wood stock at a good price. This stock will increase his profit a lot and will help to improve his living conditions.

Abed Al Nabi loves his business a lot and works on expanding it as much as he can. Most of his customers are builders and few of them come for an individual request. Abed Al Nabi is working on expanding his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a special-price stock of wood

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 49 years old and married with five children who are all in school. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Emma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, eggs, spices, noodles, etc.
In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор, ответственная, добросовестная и очень трудолюбивая женщина, разведена, имеет 4 детей. Ей 41 год. Она занимается шитьем элитных штор и занавесок. Опыт в этой деятельности более 10 лет. У Гулбахор очень много постоянных клиентов, которые приводят ей своих близких и знакомых. Её занятие является основным доходом для семьи. Она хочет накопить денег, чтобы дети ни в чем не нуждались и дать хорошее им образование. С каждого дохода она откладывает необходимую сумму. На полученный кредит планирует закупить ткани для штор и занавесок, расширить ассортимент тканей чтобы у клиентов был выбор для заказа. Она выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a responsible, fair and very hard working woman. She is divorced and has four children. She is 41 years old. She works with sewing luxury curtains and drapes. She has more than 10 years experience with this activity. Gulbahor has a lot of regular customers, who also bring their relatives and friends to her.

Gulbahor's work is the main income for the family. She wants to save up money so that her children are not missing anything, and so she can give them a good education. From every income she saves a certain amount. For the loan, she plans to buy fabric for curtains and drapes, to broaden the assortment of fabric so that her customers have a choice for their order. She expresses her gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to expand the range of fabrics for curtains and drapes

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 62 years old and married with four children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Estrella has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and earns additional income from selling rice.

Estrella aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth, a 31-year-old married lady with three children, has been selling second-hand clothes for three years now, earning a monthly income of 10,000 shillings. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD., and she plans to use it to buy more clothes to sell. With the anticipated profits, she wants to add shoes and bags to her sales business. In the future, Beth wants to have a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gamaliel De Jesus

texts.es:
Gamaliel de 34 años de edad es originario de Estelí,  casado, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de tomate, maíz y frijoles, realizo estudios hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Inicio su actividad desde hace 10 años por cuenta propia en la siembra de tomate con dinero que obtuvo de la venta de dos bueyes que le heredo su padre, se dedico a la siembra desde los 24 años de edad desde entonces ha venido luchando en su trabajo sin la necesidad de un préstamo ahora requiere de un crédito para capital de trabajo ya que el dinero que tenia ahorrado lo invirtió en el cultivo de pepino, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa y suegro, le gustaría que sus productos fueran comercializados en los supermercados debido a que lo pagan a un mejor precio.
Realiza el préstamo para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar media manzana de tomate, el considera que el préstamo le ayudara ya que podrá cubrir el 70% de los costos de producción, sus planes futuros es comprar dos manzanas de tierra para ampliar su producción, su meta próxima es obtener buenos rendimientos de la siembra de tomate.
texts.en:
Gamaliel is 34 years old and is from Estelí. He is married and is a farmer. He works planting tomatoes, corn and beans. He completed studies up until his third year of secondary school. He started this work 10 years ago with his own business by planting tomatoes with the money that he got from selling two oxen that he inherited from his father. He has been working as a farmer since he was 24 years old and since then has been working hard without the need for a loan. Now he needs a loan for working capital because he invested the money he had saved into a cucumber crop. He has his wife's and his father-in-law's support in his business. He would like to have his products sold in supermarkets because they pay the best prices.

He requested this loan to purchase inputs and to pay for labor to plant a half manzana (~0.84 acres) of tomatoes. He believes that this loan will help him to cover 70% of the production costs. His plans for the future are to purchase two more manzanas of land and to increase his production. His goal for the near future is to generate a high yield from the tomatoes he's planting.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and to pay for labor to plant his land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is from Guingona, Ozamis City. She is 34 years old. Eva is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Eva is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Eva has been in her business for eight years and earns PHP 4,000 a month for these activities.

Eva is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a chocolate and malt powder), shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2008, Eva joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma, 56 years old, is married and has one child currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 2 years, Wilma has operated a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla, 60 years old, is married and has 6 children. Perla works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a general store in the Philippines for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Perla has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Perla has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 57 years old, married, and has eleven children. With four children in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as spices, noodles, shampoo, cream, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela, 47 years old, is married and has 7 children, two of them in school. Angela works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 4 years, Angela has operated a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as soft drinks, snack foods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. In the future, Angela would like to build and expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, 52 years old, is married and has 3 children. She works very hard to provide for her family. Arlene has operated a variety store in the Philippines for 30 years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Apple Ann

texts.en:
Apple Ann, a single woman, operates an eatery business. Due to her limited education, she was not able to search for a better job. This led Apple Ann to learn how to cook snacks and viand. Apple Ann uses her business to support her parents and siblings, generating an average monthly income of about 3,000 PHP.

Apple Ann is eager to upgrade her business but she has inadequate capital. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy meat, pancit (noodles), vegetables and soft drinks to sell in her eatery. She is hoping to meet her customers' demands at affordable prices in order for them to keep supporting her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, pancit, vegetables and soft drinks

loans.name: Marinely

texts.es: MariNelly de 44 años de edad, es originaria de Granada, soltera, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su actividad con el apoyo de su mama que se dedicaba a la venta de queso y productos lácteos, mientras la mama viajaba a los  departamentos a vender los productos, ella quedaba encargada de la pulpería asi fue gustándole el negocio al que actualmente se dedica, lleva 2 años dirigiendo el negocio por sí misma, anteriormente se dedicaba a las labores domesticas de su casa para ayudarle a su mama, en el negocio ella recibe el apoyo de una sobrina menor. Solicito el préstamo para invertir en compra de granos básicos como avena, pan, arroz, azúcar, jabón, firjoles y todo lo necesario para surtir la pulpería. Sus planes futuros es tener el negocio surtido con diversos productos que demanda la clientela.
texts.en:
MariNelly is 44 years old and is from Granada. She is single and is a shopkeeper in her small grocery store. She started in this business with support from her mother, who worked selling cheese and other dairy products. While her mother traveled to other departments selling products, MariNelly ran the store and that's how she came to like the business she now works in. She has been running the business for two years. Before that she did the housework in her home to help her mother. In her business she gets help from a younger niece.

She requested this loan to invest in the purchase of staple grains (such as oats), bread, rice, sugar, soap, beans and everything she needs to stock her store. Her plan for the future is to have a store stocked with the diverse products that her customers demand.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains (such as oats), bread, rice, sugar, soap, beans and everything she needs to stock her store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with four children. She has a hotel (restaurant) and butchery business in Kimana. She has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of forty thousand shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy milk, sugar, and tea leaves to be used in the restaurant. In the future, she will expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, and tea leaves for her hotel business.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis, 38 years old, lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, all currently in school. Dennis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Dennis has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as salt, for resale, and will help Dennis to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Dennis hopes to be able to earn more profits in the future. 

Dennis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dennis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as salt

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Modesto Adali

texts.es:
Modesto es originario de San Juan de Limay- Municipio de Estelí, de 46 años de edad, casado, de oficio artesano se dedica a la elaboración de imágenes de barro, padre de 5 hijos de los cuales tres están a su cargo. Inicio con  su propio negocio desde hace 15 años, elaborando imágenes pequeñas de animalitos como búho, sapos, pajaritos, etc. Aunque el aprendio este arte a la edad de 12 años pensando que el futuro lograria poner su propio negocio y asi lo hizo.
 En su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa, sus productos son comercializados en Masaya y Estelí. No cuenta con otros ingresos pues vive de las ganancias que le genera su negocio en el cual se encuentra satisfecho porque le va bien cuenta con su  clientela. Solicita el préstamo para compra de materia prima como pinceles, barro, piedra de lijar, pinturas y pago de mano de obra, todo los utensilios necesarios para la elaboración y retoque de los distintos tipos de imágenes que realiza Modesto. 
El estima que el crédito le ayudara porque  podra comprar los materiales para elaborar esculturas grandes para exhibirlas en su negocio. Sus planes futuros es tener su propia galería y exhibición  artística ya que hoy en día  no hay muchas personas que se dediquen a este arte, sus metas próximas es elaborar esculturas artísticas y no comunes para venderlas a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Modesto is from San Juan de Limay, in the municipality of Estelí. He is 38 years old, married and works as an artist, making clay figures. He has five children, 3 of which are still under his care. He started his own business 15 years ago, making small figurines of animals like owls, frogs, birds, etc. He learned how to make this art when he was 12 years old and he always dreamed of having his own business, and now he has. 

His wife is supportive of his business. He sells his work in Masaya and Estelí. He does not have another source of income, and lives on the profits from this business. He is satisfied with his work because he has a good customer base. 

He requested a loan to buy raw materials like paint brushes, clay, sandstone and paint, and to pay for labor, which are all of the things that are required to make the unique figurines that are made by Modesto.  

He feels that the loan will help him because he will be able to buy materials to make big statues to exhibit in his store. His future plans are to have his own gallery and art exhibit. Currently there are not many artists that do this type of art. His short term goals are to make unique artistic statues, to sell for a good price.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like paint brushes, clay, sandstone and paint, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a forty-year-old married woman with three children. She has a retail shop, and has been in the business for three years now. She gets a monthly income of six thousand shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy sugar and tea leaves for sale in her business. In the future, she plans to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, who all are in school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. 

Aida is a poultry farmer, operating her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for four years and works seven days a week. 

Aida has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy poultry feed and medicine. Her major business challenges are diseases and transportation. Her goals are to educate her children to university level and also to own 2500 chickens. 

Aida lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Aida's monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and medicine

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He combines forces with his wife in order to enhance their way of life and have their own children. In 2010, he opened a hubble-bubble shop. His business has grown fast, and he is looking forward to further expanding it. He also has a small parallel business, from which he can increase his earnings.  

Today Hussein is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop and purchase a large quantity of charcoal. He notes that this will help him attract more customers. In the future, he hopes to open his own cafe.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and purchase a large quantity of charcoal

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna de 44 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 16 años al sur de la ciudad. Allí tiene una miscelánea, donde vende artículos de papelería, cosméticos, perfumería, calzado y productos para el hogar. Su negocio inició como alternativa de aportar ingresos a su hogar, vendiendo ropa, gradualmente pasó a vender calzado y con las utilidades compró vitrinas y hoy vende de todo un poco, pero ajustado a las necesidades, gustos e intereses de sus clientela. Su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, para responde a la demanda de un mercado creciente, especialmente en temporadas como la que se acerca, el día de las madres, donde hay un mayor volumen de ventas y para ello Digna debe estar preparada con inventarios en sus vitrinas para impactar su mercado y vender bien. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual Digna comprara mercancía para surtir su negocio especialmente detalles para el hogar,  que su clientela compra para esta fecha especial y papelería, para que empaquen sus regalos. Él éxito de esta inversión radica en que será aplicada a la microempresa en una época de mayor demanda de los productos que se ofrecerán en la miscelánea y que Digna al comprarlos lo hará en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado y ganará descuentos especiales.
texts.en:
Digna, age 44, lives with her husband and their two children, ages 13 and 16, to the south of the city.  She has a “miscellanea” (a small store that carries a wide variety of goods) where she sells paper goods, cosmetics, perfume, shoes, and household products.  She started her business as a way to contribute to the household income.  She was selling clothes, and she gradually came to sell shoes.  With her profits she bought display cases, and now she sells a little of everything according to the needs, likes, and interests of her clientele.

Her greatest challenge is that she does not have enough working capital to respond to the demand in a growing market.  This is especially true during times like the approaching Mother’s Day where there is a greater volume of sales.  Digna needs to be prepared for these times by having inventory in her display cases to impact her market and to have good sales.

This is exactly the reason that she turns to her Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Digna will use her loan to buy merchandise, especially household items, to stock her business.  She will do this so that her customers will make purchases for this special day, and so that they will buy paper to wrap the presents.

The success of this investment stems from the fact that it will be used in the small business during a season of great demand for the products that will be offered in her miscellanea.  Digna will buy the merchandise in greater volume than she usually does, and she will qualify for special discounts.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, especially household items, to stock her business.

loans.name: Erdenchimeg

texts.en: Erdenchimeg is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband runs his own business and her two children are kindergarten students. She started her kids' garment retailing business in early 2010. Her sales location is excellent and well known by her customers. Her garments are of good quality and affordable. Now that summer is approaching, she needs to buy more supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "now that my children are in kindergarten, I finally have time to expand my business". She's requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy more summer garments for children.

loans.use: To buy more summer garments for her children's clothing store

loans.name: Ndanaiya Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Ndanaiya Group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of  SLL 2,500,000: SLL 500,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales, boost profits and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Safea. Safea was born in Koidu. He is married and has two children attending primary schools. Safea sells watches, torches, belts, etc. He has been a businessman for eight years now. With the help of this loan, he is going to buy watches, torches, belts, etc. in large quantities to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy watches, torches, belts, etc. in large quantities to add to his current stock

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Adama from Grassfield, an area east of Freetown. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 28 years and 31 years. Adama has 5 relatives living with her at home. She is a very hard-working woman.

Adama runs a general merchandise store within a busy market. She sells rice, flour, salt, sugar, sardines, baked beans and ketchup. For the past 5 years she has been running this business. She works at the business every day except public holidays, for 11 hours a day. She does not have any source of income except her business. Adama describes her major problems as price fluctuations and low purchasing power during rainy seasons.

Adama has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities, such as bags of rice, flour, salt, sugar and cartons of sardines. The extra income will allow her to increase her savings and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!
