loans.use: To buy food commodities, such as bags of rice, flour, salt, sugar and cartons of sardines.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 42 years old. He lives in the Khoni District with his family: three children and his 84-year-old father. Zaza is a widow. His younger son and a daughter are 14 and 18 years old and go to school and the elder son is a student. 

Zaza works as a worker in the village. He also grows maize, which is sold locally, on a family-owned plot of the land. Though he works hard during the whole year, the family still lives in poverty. They receive relevant social assistance from the government. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris.

Zaza requested credit for start-up of a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Zaza will start up a dairy farm. He will purchase a milk cow and place it in the old cattle-shed located in his yard. Zaza will start production of cheese and sell it on the local market to dairy products retailers. The monthly income of the family will increase by 200 Laris, which will mean a 50% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase machinery.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old and widowed with 3 children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of 9 children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store.  Elisa is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 26 years now and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Méyévi

texts.fr:
Meyevi est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Meyevi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Meyevi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Meyevi voudrait élargir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Meyevi is a 31-year-old woman.  She is married to a teacher.  She has two children, one of whom is in school.  Her eldest child is five years old and the youngest is two.

Meyevi has been working as a retailer since 2009. She sells grains to her clientele out of her shop.  She stocks up in Lomé. She works on her own.  For the time being, her biggest challenge has been stock disruptions.  

Meyevi has requested her first loan via WAGES so that she can purchase grain.  She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Meyevi would like to grow her business.  She says that with her profits she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn and dried beans.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Isabel requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Isabel would like to save enough to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 29-year-old married woman with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 8 years. Jessica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Télé

texts.fr:
Tele est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a 2 enfants qui ne vont plus à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 19 ans.
Tele travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend de la boisson pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire la demande de tous ses clients.
Tele a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits BB. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Tele is married to a mechanic.  She has two children who are no longer in school.  The eldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 19.

Tele has been working as a retailer since 2010.  She sells beverages out of a shop for all of her clientele.  She buys her stock in Lomé.  She works on her own.  For the time being, her greatest challenge has been not being able to meet the demands of all of her clients.  

Tele is asking for her second loan via WAGES so that she can purchase BB products [inventory].  She wants to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 47 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Leny works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.  Leny has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF prior to requesting this loan.  

Leny aspires to save money, to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 56-year-old, married woman with five children.  She has a business, selling cereals in Kimana.  She has been in this business for 17 years and she earns a monthly income of 16,000 KES.

This will be Elizabeth’s first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy more assorted cereals like dry maize and beans to sell.  She hopes to grow her business and to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more assorted cereals like dry maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, conseillère du groupe de crédit  Hodari, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur vertébrée expérimentée, âgée de 50 ans, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des  petits articles devant son domicile notamment (Riz, sucres, Fanta, savons, sels, épisses, etc.) Son mari est actuellement chômeur. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de Hekima, de lors qu’elle fut informée par ses voisins des activités de cette IMF dans la ville de Goma. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des équipements ménagers importants pour sa famille. Ainsi, elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 cartons de biscuits, 10 casiers de Fanta, 2 bidons d’huile de Rina, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The borrower is the leader of the Hodaridari lending group.  She is a dynamic and experienced entrepreneur with a spine.  She is 50 years old and mother to eight children who are all in school.  She sells small items outside of her home, notably rice, sugars, Fanta, soaps, salts, spices, etc.  Her husband is currently unemployed.

She founded her business with a loan thorough Hekima upon hearing about the activities of the MFI in the city of Goma from her neighbours. The profits from her business are used for savings, food, and tuition for her children.  However, she just completed her seventh loan cycle.  Over the course of this time period, She has seen her business prosper well.

Thanks to loans through Hekima, she has been able to garner household essentials for her family, and so she has decided to take out a larger loan this time.  This loan will enable her to buy 2 crates of biscuits, 10 cases of Fanta, 2 cans of Rina oil, etc. for her inventory.  

Moreover, she hopes to see her children grow up in comfort. She thanks Hekima and their partners for empowering poor, low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase 2 crates of biscuits, 10 cases of Fanta, 2 cans of Rina oil, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo
